content: SIX! Within a distance of a hit now, is England! He has picked the bones out of that one! Jadeja pitches it outside leg again, too full and into the wheelhouse. Jamie Smith picks the length in a trice and slogs it over deep square leg for a long six.
FOUR! In a hurry now! Dropped full and on middle. Jamie Smith gets low down on his knee and slogs it through the open mid-wicket space for a boundary.
Over the stumps, full and outside leg. Jamie Smith leans on and blocks it back to Jadeja.

EDGED, FOUR! Just wide enough to reach the fence. And another FIFTY FOR JOE ROOT! His 66th in Test cricket! A marvellous inning from the former English skipper. Hard length, outside off. Joe Root throws his bat at it to work through covers, but gets a thick outside edge. The ball flies flat and wide of the diving gully fielder and races behind to deep third for a boundary. The crowd in Headingley loves it and cheers in unison as they see their side inching very close to scripting history. England need 16 more runs to win!
Almost! Back of a length, kisses the surface and skids outside off. Joe Root goes for a square cut, but the ball passes over his angled bat.
On top of off, Jamie Smith steers it through mid-wicket for a single.

Closer to the off pole, on a nagging length, angling in. Jamie Smith weighs on the back foot to play it with the bounce, but gets an inside edge onto the front pad, and the ball then rolls into cover.
Goes straight on off, length, Jamie Smith gets behind it and taps it out to the off side.

The 350 is up for England! Hard length, not much movement, outside off, Joe Root plays the square cut off the back foot to deep backward point. Pinches in a single. Just 21 required for England to win.
On off, on a length, eased to cover by Smith.
Slower and at the stumps, Jamie strides forward to keep it out.
On middle and leg, Smith defends it by getting forward.
Fuller and on the pads, Smith defends outside the line and wears it on the front pad.
Slower and shorter, on off, Root taps it through point for a single.
Pushed across, on a length, Root pushes it to cover.

FOUR! Shardul Thakur serves it on the fuller length, outside off. Jamie Smith stays back and opens the face of his blade to guide it through deep backward point for a boundary. Now, England needs 23 runs.
Pitched up, on off, Smith shows the full face of the bat and firms the drive down the ground where Mohammed Siraj cuts it off with a tumble to his left.
On a good length, outside off. Joe Root shuffles across the off stump and flicks it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Outside off, on a good length, Smith gets down and across the stumps to knock it to the left of mid off for a single.
On a hard length, outside off. Jamie Smith throws his hands at it and looks to slash it but gets an under edge that dribbles towards Rishabh Pant.
On a back of a length, outside off, Root arches back and cuts it to deep backward point for a single. England need 29 more runs to win!
Slows it down but keeps it short, around leg, Smith pats it down the deck.
Turning away, on the fuller side,Smith smothers the spin by getting forward.
A hint of turn, flat and short, on leg, Smith gets behind it to defend.
At the stumps, Smith works this full ball to cover.
Shorter and quicker, around leg, Smith hops and nudges it beside the pitch on the leg side.
From over the wicket, around leg, Smith blocks it out off the front foot.
Fuller and wide outside off. Slower one from Thakur and Joe Root looks to drive it but mistimes it to extra cover.
Lands it on a length, on middle and leg, Jamie whips it to the right of mid on where Yashasvi Jaiswal slides to cut it off. They cross.
On a good length, outside off. Jamie Smith looks to drive that one, but gets an inside edge to the left of the fine leg fielder for a couple of runs.
Uh, oh, it's a NO BALL as Shardul Thakur has overstepped! On the back of a length, outside off. Jamie Smith punches it to mid off.
On a back of a length, outside off, Root steers it down to deep third for one.
Bowls it on a back of a length, wide outside off. Jamie Smith sees the width and opens his arms to slap it to deep cover for a single.
Thakur serves it on a nagging length, around off, Smith drives it on the up to the right of deep point for a couple of runs.
Sliding on with the angle, short and on middle, Joe Root goes back to keep it out on the leg side.

FOUR! Edgy! Slower through the air, full and on off, Root defends it with soft hands. The ball spins just enough to catch the outside edge but it goes down onto the ground. It goes between the first slip and the diving Sai Sudharsan at gully for a boundary.
Fired in, fuller and on off, Root gets a good stride in to block.
Pushed through, this kicks up a bit, short and around off, Root arches back and dabs it to backward point.
Sliding on with the arm, on the pads, on a nagging length, Jamie tucks it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Bowls it short but slow, outside off, Smith goes for the cut but misses.
On a back of a length, outside off. Jamie Smith looks to drive that one but gets an inside edge to the short fine leg region. Single taken.

A gentle inswinger on a length, on middle. Joe Root brings his bat in front to push it straight, but gets a thick inside edge and the ball rolls into the mid-wicket region for a single. Root is keen to push for the second, but Smith sends him back.
Lands it on the back of a length, outside off. Joe Root works it to mid on.
Back of a length, on off and middle. Joe Root shuffles across, comes forward and flicks this along the ground past mid-wicket for a couple of runs. Smart batting this from the former English skipper!
Pitches it on the back of a length, outside off. Joe Root shuffles a bit and blocks it right under his eyes.
Tails in a touch, on a length, punched back by Root on the back foot.

FOUR! Magnificent! The target is now under 50 for England! Floated up and fuller, on off, Jamie Smith plants his front foot out and carves this through cover for a cracking boundary. England need 47 runs to win, with 5 wickets in hand.
Fuller and on off, driven inside out to cover.
Nice and full, on off, eased into the off side.
Full and on the stumps, spins away. Smith defends it out off the outer half to the slip region.

BEATEN! Spin for Jadeja! Arm ball, outside off. Lands and takes a sharp turn away from the batter, with a prodigious bounce. Smith is beaten on the outside edge and it also catches Pant off guard as the ball lobs off his gloves and rolls to his left.
Dropped on a length, on off, Joe Root flicks this wide of mid on for a single.
On a full length, outside off. Jamie Smith prods forward and drives it to mid off.
Full, right in front of the stumps, Smith is solid in defence.
FOUR! Excellent shot from Jamie Smith! Prasidh Krishna serves it on good length and wide outside off. Jamie Smith stands tall and punches it along the ground through covers for a boundary.

Oh, almost dragged on! Outside off, full, jagging back in a touch. Joe Root presses ahead to block it off, but is a bit late to bring his bat down and hence, gets an inside edge. The ball then rolls off the thigh pad to the short fine leg region. A single taken as Pant chases it.
Bowls it on the back of a length, outside off. Jamie Smith cuts that one to deep backward point for one.
Two slips for Smith. Nagging length, just around off, Jamie Smith dabs it off the back foot to short cover.
Another full ball, spinning away from middle. Joe Root lunges forward and defends onto the pitch. A quick over from Jadeja.
Full and on middle, blocked straight back.
Full, flat, quick, on off. Joe Root presses forward and defends it out.
Attacks the off pole, on a length, Joe Root hangs back and punches it to point.
Floated wide of off, on a yard behind full length. Jamie Smith leans back and cuts it to deep point for one.
Two slips ambush the batter now. Full, on off, eased into the off side.
On a length, outside off. Joe Root opens the face of his blade and guides it to the gully region.
Holds the line of the stumps, does Krishna, on a fuller length. Joe Root gets behind the line and blocks it under his eyes.
On a back of a length, outside off. Joe Root taps it to backward point and wants a single, but is sent back by his partner.
Spears it full and on off, pushed down with a straight bat to mid on.
On a good length, outside off. Joe Root drives it to the cover fielder.

FOUR! What a glorious shot! Perfect textbook cricketing stroke that! 'Skiddy' bowls it full and keeps it outside off. Joe Root presses forward and caresses it through covers for a boundary. Didn't try to hit it too hard, just pure class and timing on that. The target now shrinks to 59 runs to win.
Darted outside off, on a length, Smith leaves.
BEATEN! Drifts in with the arm, lands on off and then bites away off the surface. Jamie Smith is drawn forward for a defence, but plays inside the line and is beaten by a kitten-whisker.
Pitched fuller and outside off. Jamie Smith gets on the front foot to drive through the covers, but the ball goes off the outer half and rolls towards short third.
Full and going on with the arm, on off, pushed back to Jadeja.
Drags the length back, spins away from off. Joe Root waits for the ball and cuts it to the right of point for a single.
A silly mid off in place for Jadeja. Bowls it on a length, on off, Jamie Smith goes back and across and tucks this into mid-wicket for a single.
Pitches it fuller, angling onto the pads. Jamie Smith clips it to mid-wicket for a single.
On the back of a length, at off, nipping in. Jamie Smith rocks back and taps it out to the point region.
Lands it on a fuller length, on off. Jamie Smith prods forward and drives it straight to the cover fielder.
Straighter and fuller, just around off. Jamie Smith leans forward and blocks it right under his eyes.
On a back of a length, outside off. Joe Root shuffles across the off stump and taps it to the backward point region for one.
Back of a length, outside off, Joe Root rises with the bounce and cuts it behind square to deep backward point for a couple of quick runs.
Full and on off, Smith presses forward to keep it out.
With a silly point in place, Jadeja spears in a full ball, on off, Smith gets his bat out in front to block.
Darted in, on off, Smith defends it off the front foot.

OUT! CAUGHT! Ravindra Jadeja finally gets his man! This is tossed up by Jadeja, around the off stump, Stokes reaches out in front and goes hard on the reverse. The ball lands in front of the bat and takes the top edge and it eventually lobs off the shoulder of Stokes. It pops up for an easy catch for Shubman Gill at short third. A timely wicket for India. Stokes falls for 33 (51). England are now 302/5, needing 69 more runs.
Ben Stokes (c) c S Gill b R Jadeja 33 (51b 4x4 0x6)
Short and on off, Root dabs it wide of cover for a single.
Turning in, short and around off, Stokes walks outside the line of the off stump and plays the reverse to deep point for a single.
Hits the deck hard, on a good length, Root goes deep in the crease to keep it out.
On the fuller side, on off, Root gets forward to defend.
On a back of a length, angled into the pads, Stokes glances it to deep backward square leg for a single. 300 up for England. They need 71 more runs to win.

EDGED, FOUR! Going all south for India now! Just outside off, on a fullish length, just does enough to nip away from the batter. Ben Stokes brings the bat in front to push that into the off side, but gets a thick, healthy outside edge. With a wide first slip on, the ball passes between the keeper and the wide first slip for a boundary at deep third.

FOUR! That is a glorious stroke! Fuller ball, outside off, nipping away. Ben Stokes jumps out of his bunker and thrashes that hard and through the covers for a boundary. Seeing off Bumrah's spell quietly, and attacking the others, this has been the plan by England and it has worked magnificently for the hosts, of course, with a good execution.
Straight and full, on off, Ben Stokes drills it to the left of mid off and the fielder makes the stop.
Darted in, on a nagging length, on middle, Root defends with his bat close to the front pad.

FOUR! Another error in the field and this has gone into the ropes! Floated up, on off, Root presses forward and steers it towards backward point where Karun Nair runs in but does not get low enough. The ball goes through his legs and races away.
Fuller and slower, on off, eased to cover by Root.
Short and on off, Joe guides it off the back foot to backward point.
Full and around off, reverse swept to deep backward point for a single by Stokes.

Lands safely for Ben Stokes but did that come off the glove? Speared in, on a nagging length, on off, Stokes reaches out in front for the reverse sweep. Does not quite connect and the replays show that it indeed came off the glove. Rishabh Pant was blinded by Stokes standing in front of him and was not aware of where the ball was. It lobbed and landed beside him Stokes to his right and in front of the charging KL Rahul at leg slip.
Goes for a full ball, attacking the front pad, Stokes helps it down to deep fine leg for a single.
On off, on a back of a length, Ben plays it back to Bumrah.
On a hard length, on off, Stokes rides the bounce and steers it to gully.
Tighter line, on a good length, Stokes stays back and defends it close to his body.
Play and a miss! On a length, wide on off, Stokes cannot resist seeing the width. Throws his hands at the ball and gets beaten on the outside edge.
Hits the deck hard, on a back of a length, on off, Stokes stands tall and punches it to short cover.
Slower and around off, Root pats it beside the pitch on the off side.
On off from around the wicket, Root blocks it out off the front foot.
Full and on off, Stokes reverse sweeps it along the ground to deep point for one.

This spins back in sharply and rears up a bit too, on a nagging length, Stokes misses out on the reverse but Rishabh Pant does well to get his body behind the ball and prevents the ball from going past him.
Full again, on off, Stokes attempts the reverse sweep again and under edges it on the bounce to short third.
Too full for the reverse sweep, on off, Stokes still goes for it. Gets an inside edge onto the front pad.
On a nagging length, on off, Joe tucks it off the back foot to mid-wicket.
Slanting into the right-hander, on a back of a length, on off, Root gets right behind the line and pushes it down the deck.
Good running! Loopy slower one from Bumrah, fuller and on off, Stokes picks the slower one and taps it in front of mid on for a quick single.
Serves it on a good length, on off, the English skipper is solid in defence.
On off, on a back of a length, Stokes hangs back to block.
Full and on off, driven firmly but straight to cover by Stokes.
Flatter and fuller, on the leg stump line, Ben Stokes sits down and reverse sweeps it to deep backward point for a single.
Flatter and shorter, around off, Ben Stokes goes for the reverse and gets it off the bottom towards short third.

Sloppy from Shardul Thakur! Full and on middle, Root drives it off the front foot to mid on where Thakur slides to his left but the ball gets past him. Shardul is late to get back up on his feet and by the time he recovers, the batters run three. Jadeja is not pleased one bit and he lets Shardul know with an earful.

A beauty from Ravindra Jadeja! Angling in and then straightening, on off, Root brings his bat out in front to defend but plays for the ball sliding on with the arm. It sneaks past the outside edge and goes just past the off pole.

A massive appeal for LBW but turned down! It was a celebrappeal from Ravindra Jadeja and India have taken the review. This comes on with the arm, on a nagging length, on middle, Root lunges and looks to keep it out with a straight bat. The ball sneaks past the inside edge and catches Root on the front pad. The UltraEdge shows no bat, but guess what, the Ball Tracking shows that the ball is going over the leg stump. It did not look so to the naked eye. India have no reviews left.

FOUR! Expertly played! Sliding on with the arm from around the wicket, full and on middle, Root takes the risk of playing the reverse sweep against the angle. Manages to connect well and it goes along the ground, past short third for a boundary.
Goes fuller, just outside the off stump, Stokes defends it right under his eyes. A maiden from Bumrah!
Attacking the stumps, on a nagging length, tapped to mid on.
Hurls it on a good length, on off, Ben Stokes gets right behind it. Bumrah falls over in his follow-through but no harm done.
Drags the length back, on off, Ben rises with the bounce and stays back to defend. Gets it off the inner half beside the pitch on the leg side.
A bit of tail back into the left-hander, on the fuller side, on off, Stokes toe-ends the drive to mid off.
Bumrah is on the money straight away! On top of off, on a back of a length from around the wicket, Stokes hops back and chops it down the deck.
Flatter and shorter, this kicks up a bit, on middle, Joe rides the bounce and blocks.
On the leg stump line, on a length, Root wrists it to short mid-wicket.
Full and on middle, Joe gets on the front foot and knocks it to cover.
Tossed up, full and on off, bowled from wide of the crease, Stokes reaches out in front and reverse sweeps it to deep backward point for a run.
This keeps a bit low, on the shorter side, on off, Root pats it wide of cover and crosses over.
Short and around leg, Root pads it away.

FOUR! Streaky but they all count! Full and wide on off, Stokes frees his arms and goes for the drive. Gets it off the toe end and it races through the gap between the second slip and gully for a boundary.  The runs required are now under 100 for England. They need 98 more runs.
Outside off, on a good length, Stokes walks across the stumps and leaves the ball alone.
Pitched up from around the wicket, on off, Stokes firms the drive back to Shardul.
Angled in at the hips, on a short of a length, Ben whips it off the back foot to the right of deep backward square leg for a brace.
On a back of a length, on middle, Root hops and nudges it through mid-wicket for a single.
Seaming back in, on off, on a length, Root covers the off stump and makes the leave.

On a fullish length, on off, Stokes gets his hands through the ball quickly and nails the reverse sweep to deep backward point. Prasidh Krishna moves to his left to cut it off but a fumble allows the batters to take the second run.
Spinning back in sharply, on a nagging length, on middle, Stokes is taken aback by the turn and bounce and catches it on the waist.
A bit quicker, outside off, on a length, Ben gets outside the line of the off stump while playing the reverse. Gets beaten on the inside edge and catches it on the front pad.
Turning in, on off, on a nagging length, Stokes tucks it on the bounce to short leg.
On the fuller side, on middle, Joe knocks it in front of mid off and takes a single.
From over the wicket, on a nagging length, around leg, Root helps it towards short fine leg.
On a good length, outside off, Stokes shoulders arms.
This moves in the air towards Stokes, on off, Ben walks across and looks to work it across with the angle. Gets a soft leading edge towards cover.
In the channnel on off, on a nagging length, Stokes lets it pass.
Fuller and on off, Stokes lunges to block it out.
FOUR! Edged away! On a length, outside off, Stokes gets on the front foot for the drive. Gets an outside edge that goes low and wide to the left of the diving KL Rahul at gully for a boundary.

From around the wicket, on a back of a length, over middle, Ben Stokes walks across the stumps and shoulders arms. The ball catches Stokes on the waist and rolls behind towards deep fine leg. There was no shot offered and therefore, Stokes did not run.
Fired in, fuller and on off, Stokes reverse sweeps it all along the ground to deep point for one.

Oh, my goodness! Another one from Jadeja landing on the rough and shoots up a bit, Ben Stokes reaches out in front and swings hard for the reverse sweep. The ball spins past him and goes over the stumps. Catches Rishabh Pant on the chest.
Very full, on the leg stump line, Root reverse sweeps it to deep backward point for a single.
Pushed through, short and outside off, cut away past point for a single by Stokes.

Caught by Sai Sudharsan at short leg and India go up in unison but the finger stays down. Shubman Gill has a word with the keeper and the bowler. Sudharsan looks convinced and India take the review. Tossed up from over the wicket, on a nagging length, around off, Stokes reaches out in front for the reverse but the ball spins past the bat and hits Ben on the right forearm before lobbing to short leg. UltraEdge confirms that there is no bat or glove involved. India lose another review and now have only one review left.

Woah! This lands on the rough and spins back in sharply, short and on off, Stokes hangs back to work it with the spin. Gets beaten by the turn as the ball bites in the surface and lobs off the body but drops in front of the batter.
This kicks up a bit, on a back of a length, on off, Root stays back to keep it out.

From around the wicket, on a length, on middle, Ben Stokes brings his wrists into play and flicks it through mid-wicket. Ravindra Jadeja goes after it and puts in a slide to prevent the ball from touching the ropes. Flicks it back in and Stokes collects three to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Strangled down the leg side! Two in two for Shardul Thakur and this will uplift the Indian spirits big time. An innocuous delivery, sliding down leg, on a length, Brook walks down the track and gets inside the line for the tickle. Ends up getting a feather on it and Rishabh Pant dives to his left to pouch it. 99 in the first innings but a golden duck in the second for Brook. And now, from 253/2, England have slipped down to 253/4. Shardul is on a hat-trick.
Harry Brook c R Pant b S Thakur 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! CAUGHT! Ben Duckett cannot quite believe it! The Headingley crowd rise to applaud Duckett for what has been a knock that is worth its weight in gold. Pitched up by Thakur from around the wicket, around off, Duckett is sort of lured by the full ball and his eyes light up. Goes hard on the drive and cannot keep the shot along the ground. Hits it hard and low to the left of cover where the substitute fielder, Nitish Kumar Reddy stays low to snaffle it. The Headingley rises in appreciation for a knock that will be remembered for a long time as Ben Duckett walks to the dressing room, scoring 149 (170). England are 253/3 now.
Ben Duckett c sub Nitish Kumar Reddy b Shardul Thakur 149 (170b 21x4 1x6)
Fuller and on off, Ben Duckett gets forward to defend.
Beaten! From around the wicket, on a length, on off, Duckett presses forward for the drive. The ball nips away to go past the outside edge.
Looped up, full and on off, Ben reaches out in front and knocks it to long on for a single. Moves to 149!

FOUR! You can't keep Ben Duckett quiet for long! Tossed up by Jadeja, a bit too full, outside off, Duckett connects with the reverse sweep and plays it fine of the man at deep backward point for a boundary.
Bowled from wide of the crease, fuller and on off, Duckett blocks it out.
Flatter and shorter, outside off, Ben keeps it out on the off side.
Slower through the air, outside off, on a nagging length, Ben Duckett goes for the slog sweep but misses as the ball kicks up a bit to go over the bat.
This spins back in sharply from the rough, on a nagging length, Ben ekes out an inside edge onto the waist.
This is on a short of a good length, on off, Root stands tall and pats it down the deck.
On a back of a length, on off, Root gets on his toes and eases it to point.
On off, on a good length, steered with an open bat face to deep backward point for one.
A bit of effort put by Shardul, on a good length, on off, Duckett pushes it back to Thakur.
On off from around the wicket, on a back of a length, Duckett hangs back to block.

Leg bye! On a back of a length, on middle, Root takes a step down the track and walks inside the line for the tickle. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the pads beside the pitch on the leg side for a leg bye.

SIX! WOW! Extraordinary by Ben Duckett! Bowled with a flatter trajectory, on the fuller side, at the stumps, Ben Duckett absolutely nails the reverse sweep. Gets the hands through the ball quickly and hits it for a flat six over deep point.
Stays over the wicket for the right-hander, targetting the rough on the line of the leg stump, Root brings out the reverse and plays it to deep backward point for a single.
Floated up, fuller and on off, Ben Duckett goes for the full-blooded reverse sweep. Hits it on the bounce to deep backward point for one.
On the shorter side, around off, Duckett pushes it back to Jadeja.
Slower and this spins back in, short and on off, Ben dabs it down on the leg side.
Pushed through, on the off stump, on a nagging length, Ben plants his front foot across and tickles it to short fine leg.
On the pads, on a short of a length, tucked behind square on the leg side for a single. 9 runs off the over. England 133 more runs.

FOUR! Not in complete control but the boundaries continue to flow off Duckett's bat! This bumper from around the wicket climbs onto the batter, Ben gets his hands to ride the bounce and control the pull. Does not succeed in doing so and gets a top edge that races down to deep fine leg for four more.
Comes from around the wicket now, on a back of a length, outside off, Duckett drags the pull down to mid on.
FOUR! Hit with absolute authority! A half-volley from Prasidh Krishna, angled across, Duckett goes deep in the crease and gets his weight into the shot. Drills it to the left of cover for a boundary.
Very full, on off, Ben mistimes the drive to mid off.
Angled away, on a nagging length, on off, Duckett taps it down the deck.
Pitched up, outside off, Root leans forward for the drive. Miscues it off the inner half to mid-wicket.
Attacking the front pad, on a length, Joe wrists it to mid-wicket off the front foot.
Fuller and closer to the off stump, Joe tucks his bat behind the front pad and leaves the ball alone.
Angling in, on a back of a length, outside off, Root covers the off stump and shoulders arms.
Outside off, on a good length, Joe lets it be.

On off, on a good length from around the wicket, Ben Duckett hangs his bat out a bit away from his body with no real conviction. Gets an inside edge and it drops beside the pitch on the leg side. They cross.
Lands it on a short of a length, outside off. Joe Root looks to pull that one but mistimes it to mid-wicket. He certainly missed out on that one.
This shapes a bit in the air towards the right-hander, very full, on off, Joe squeezes it out back to the bowler.
Bowls it on a good length, on middle and off. Joe Root clips it to mid on and Mohammed Siraj there moves to his right to cut it off.

Good running! On a good length, on off, Root gets on top of the bounce and guides it in the vacant point region. By the time Jasprit Bumrah runs across to his right from deep backward point, Root gets back for the second.
On the back of a length, outside off. Ben Duckett lets the ball come to him and dabs it to third man for a single.
On the pads, on a length, Root does fall a bit towards the off side but manages to flick it to deep backward square leg for a single.
On a length, outside off. Ben Duckett gets on the back foot and punches it to the off side.

FOUR! In complete control! From around the wicket, this is dug in short by Bumrah, around the left shoulder of the batter. The ball climbs on Ben Duckett but he does well to control the pull by rolling his wrists over the ball. Keeps it along the ground and picks the gap between deep fine leg and deep square leg for a boundary.
Comes from around the wicket and bowls it on a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett prods forward and blocks it back to the bowler.
A bit full, attacking the front pad, Joe Root wrists it to the right of mid-wicket and takes the single.

FOUR! Nicely timed by Joe Root! Jasprit Bumrah serves it on the back of a length, outside off stump. A bit of away movement on that, and Joe Root rocks back and opens the face of his blade to guide it through backward point for a boundary.
On a back of a length, on middle, Root flicks it off the pads to mid-wicket.

BEATEN! Another peach from Prasidh Krishna! Bowls it on a good length, just around that fifth stump line, angling away from the batter. Ben Duckett plays inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge. 'Skiddy' has looked much sharper and accurate in this spell of his and has his chest pumped out after those two quick wickets.
On a good length, on off, kept out on the off side.

Mix-up but no harm done! On a hard length, on off, Root gets on his toes to pull it away. The ball sneaks under the bat and catches him on the waist. The ball rolls in front of point and Root gets called through by Ben Duckett. The throw goes to the bowling end with Root being late to set off. The ball hits the stumps and deflects away towards mid on where the substitute fielder, Nitish Kumar Reddy, puts in a dive to make the stop to his right. The ball rolls away to his right off his body and Duckett wants to sneak in an overthrow and is almost halfway through before Root sends him back.

Oh, my! So close! This nips back in sharply, on a nagging length, Root is cut in half as he stays on the back foot to punch it away. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball sneaks over the stumps.
On a good length, angling into the batter. Joe Root flicks it straight to the mid-wicket fielder.
Angled across, on a back of a length, Duckett hangs back and taps it in front of the man at cover for a single.
On a back of a length, outside off. Joe Root rides the bounce and nudges it to the off side. England need 158 runs to win, in a minimum of 50 overs remaining, with 8 wickets in hand.
Hurls it fuller in length and this is bowled from wide of the crease, outside off, Joe lets it be.
On a good length, angling onto the off stump. Ben Duckett cuts that one from the back foot to deep backward point. Single taken.
On a hard length, on off, Duckett hops and stabs it beside the pitch on the off side.

This keeps low and jags back in, on a good length, on middle, Root is deep in his crease to deal with it. Just about manages to get some bat on it. Ekes out an inside edge to deep backward square leg for a single.
Lands it on a back of a length, in the channel on off, Root hops back, covers the off stump and makes the leave.

FOUR! Ben Duckett continues to motor along. Prasidh Krishna bowls it on the back of a length, wide outside off. Ben Duckett sees the width and throws his hands towards it to cut it nicely to deep third man for a boundary.
Gets it very full, on middle, Root jams it out wide of mid on and gets off the mark with a single.

OUT! DRAGGED ON! Ollie Pope will consider himself a bit unfortunate! This is the nip-backer from Prasidh, on a back of a length, on middle, Ollie stays on the back foot and sets up to play it with a straight bat back towards the bowler. The ball jags back in off the deck to catch the inside edge. The ball goes on to hit the back thigh and it deflects back onto the stumps. Wickets in successive overs for Prasidh Krishna, despite being inconsistent with his lengths. England are 206/2, needing 165 more runs.
Ollie Pope b P Krishna 8 (8b 2x4 0x6)
Leg bye! Too straight, on the pads, on a length, Duckett fails to help it away. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the thigh pad towards square leg.

FOUR! Punished! Prasidh Krishna lands it on a short length, outside off. Ben Duckett gets on the back foot and it sits up nicely for him to pull through mid-wicket along the ground for a boundary. The runs are coming thick and fast for England.
On a good length, on middle, Ben Duckett gets behind the line and punches it to mid on.

FOUR! Nicely done! 2nd boundary in 7 balls for Pope. On the shorter side, sliding on with the arm, on off, Ollie Pope backs away and cuts it off the stumps through backward point for a boundary. 200 comes up for England. They need 170 more runs to win.
Darted in, full and on middle, Pope gets forward to push it to cover.
Shortish, just outside off. Ollie Pope rocks back and guides it to short third.
Short and turning into the pads, Ben waits for it and works it with the spin past short leg for a single.
Tossed up and fuller, on off. Ben Duckett gets on the front foot and taps it to mid on.

FOUR! Ben Duckett continues to reap rewards from the reverse sweep! Flat and fractionally short, on off, Duckett gets into the position quickly by moving across to the off side. Reaches out in front and gets on top of the bounce to hit it all along the ground. Beats the diving Prasidh Krishna at deep backward point to his left for a boundary.
On a good length, wide outside off. Ollie Pope lets it go.
In the corridor on off, on a good length, Ollie Pope shoulders arms.
FOUR! Ollie Pope gets off the mark with a boundary! Prasidh Krishna serves it on the full length, angling on the pads. Ollie Pope uses his wrists and flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a boundary.
In the channel on off, on a nagging length, left alone by Pope.

OUT! CAUGHT! Prasidh Krishna finds the edge and India finally have a breakthrough! End of a fine knock from Zak Crawley. He has set up the chase nicely for his side. Prasidh corrects his length and goes full this time. The ball moves away in the air and Crawley is lured into the drive. Does not move his feet much and goes at it with his hands. Gets an outside edge that goes straight to KL Rahul at first slip. Rahul stays side on and takes it to his right at chest height. Rahul seemed to indicate that the ball climbed on him. Crawley falls for 65 (126). England are now 188/1, needing 183 more runs.
Zak Crawley c K Rahul b P Krishna 65 (126b 7x4 0x6)

FOUR! Clubbed! Prasidh Krishna bangs into the wicket but fails to get it high enough to trouble the batter, around off. This sits up to be hit and Crawley swats it with a flat bat to the right of a diving Jasprit Bumrah at mid on for a boundary.
Fuller, outside off. Ben Duckett prods forward and blocks it to the bowler.
Floated up, fuller and slower, on off, Zak presses forward and taps it with soft hands in front of cover for a single.
Fuller and on the leg stump. Zak Crawley pads it away to the off side.
A bit too short, on off, Ben Duckett premeditates for the reverse and waits a bit to adjust to the length. Plays it down to deep third for a single.
Slower and shortish, on the off stump. Ben Duckett lunges forward and defends it back to the bowler.
Short and around the pads, Zak goes on the back foot and flicks it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Bowls it on a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett prods forward and blocks it to mid off.
Short of full, on off, Zak Crawley presses forward and taps it in front of cover and pinches in a quick single.
On a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett steers it to deep backward point for a single.
SWING AND A MISS! Speared fuller and just outside off. Ben Duckett clears the front leg to smash it down the ground, but misses.
On a back of a length, angling into the stumps. Zak Crawley taps it to the right of the bowler for a quick single.
Outside off, on a hard length, Ben Duckett cuts it away to deep backward point for a single.
Fuller, on the off stump. Ben Duckett once again sits down on his knee and reverse sweeps it to deep backward point for one.
Length, spinning in from off, stabbed back to the bowler off the back foot.

FOUR! HUNDRED FOR BEN DUCKETT! What a flamboyant innings from him His 6th Test century! An inning of high caliber and quality. Jadeja floats it fuller and keeps it in front of the stumps. Ben Duckett premeditates it and reverse sweeps it to deep point for a boundary. The Headingley crowd is on its feet, cheering in jubilation as Duckett celebrates with a leap of joy, with the mizzle in the background. Batted under extreme conditions, even got dropped on 98, just a few moments back, and has produced a gem of a knock so far for his side.
Flighted fuller, on middle, clipped to short leg.
Quicker and fuller, outside off. Ben Duckett sits down on one knee and looks to reverse sweep but misses it.

FOUR BYES! England need under 200 now! Full and spinning sharply across the batter, down leg. Ben Duckett looks to flick it away, but misses and the ball spins far away from the keeper's right and races away to the deep fine leg fence.

Bowls it on a good length, angling onto the pads. Zak Crawley looks to clip it to the leg side but misses it and wears it on the front thigh pad. A half-hearted appeal of LBW from Mohammed Siraj as it looks like going down the leg side.

IN THE AIR... DROPPED! Yashasvi Jaiswal is the culprit for one more time, and Mohammed Siraj just cannot believe it! Hands on his waist for him and is really hot under the collar! Nothing going India's way quite really! Mohammed Siraj bowls a well-directed short ball, angling into the batter's body. Ben Duckett gets the ball high on his shoulder height and shapes to pull. Gets a top edge and the ball flies behind square on the leg side. Yashasvi Jaiswal from deep backward square leg runs in and dives forward to scoop the ball, but doesn't cling on to it and shells it. A single taken and more importantly, Duckett is offered a reprieve.
On a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett opens his arms and cuts it straight to the gully fielder.
Full and wide on off, Ben Duckett cuts this to the left of deep backward point. Shardul Thakur scoots to his left and dives to intercept the ball. Two taken.
On a nagging length, angling onto the off stump. Ben Duckett gets on the front foot and closes the face of the bat early, and gets a leading edge to mid off.
BEATEN! Around the stumps, touch full and nibbling away. Ben Duckett is drawn on the front foot and has a poke at it. The ball beats the bat by just a kitten whisker.
Fuller and outside off. Ben Duckett gets forward and taps it to long on for a single.
Over the stumps. Lands on one of those roughs, outside off, on a length. It bites off the pitch and spins back sharply in, and bouncing off, flummoxing Duckett who sways away from the line to leave.

FOUR! Another reverse sweep from Ben Duckett! Ravindra Jadeja lands it fuller and outside leg. Ben Duckett once again sits down on one knee and reverse sweeps it to the deep cover region for a boundary.
Flat and full, on middle, Ben Duckett blocks it out to the pitch.
FOUR! Innovative and mighty effective! Ravindra Jadeja bowls it fuller, on the stumps. Ben Duckett gets down on one knee and nails the reverse sweep to the deep point region for a boundary.
Tossed up full and on off, Ben Duckett pushes it back to the bowler.
Lands it on the short of a length, outside off. Zak Crawley rocks back and pulls it to the deep mid-wicket region for a couple of runs.
Full and straight on off, Zak Crawley presses forward and knocks it to cover.
On a good length, just around the off stump. Zak Crawley prods forward and blocks it back to the bowler.
Cannons this on a hard length, on off, Zak Crawley goes for the defence, but inside edges on the front pad.
Slower ball, full and outside off, Zak Crawley sees it closely and taps it out.
FOUR! More runs! This is really good batting! Touch full and and angling on middle Zak Crawley prods forward and uses his wrists to flick it through mid-wicket for a boundary.

EDGED, FOUR! More frustrations for India! And runs off every ball in this over! An away shape from off, on the back of a length. Ben Duckett, with a tentative poke at it, gets a thick outside edge and the ball goes through the gap between the keeper and KL Rahul at second slip for a boundary. There is no first slip but Rahul gestures that it would have bounced in front.
Aims the middle pole, does Siraj as he falls over on the follow-through. Zak Crawley brings his bat in front and gets a thick inside edge. The ball rolls to deep backward square leg for a single.
Bashes the length hard, on off, Ben Duckett hops off to stay leg side and guides it to deep backward point for a single.

FOUR! Gets it through! Pitched up by Siraj, on off, Ben Duckett gets his hands through the ball and drives it to the right of mid off. Prasidh Krishna moves to his right and dives to make the stop. He does get to the ball but it bounces past him for a boundary. Siraj feels that Prasidh should have done better there.

FIFTY FOR CRAWLEY! 17th Test half-century for Crawley and it has come at a crucial time for England. Honing in at the stumps, on a length, Zak presses forward and pushes it in front of mid on and crosses over.
Tailing back into the pads from around the wicket, on a length, Ben Duckett flicks it in front of square on the leg side for a single.
Fairly outside off, nibbling away. Another leave from Crawley. 9 runs from this over.
Nagging length, outside off, Zak leaves.

FOUR! Into the gap and they have sneaked two boundaries off Bumrah's over! Back of a length, swinging into the batter. Zak Crawley with a half prod forward flicks this into the vacant deep square leg region for a boundary.
Spears fuller and angling in on the stumps, Zak Crawley pushes this to mid on.
Nips away from outside off, on a length. An easy back foot cut for Duckett through point for a single.

FOUR! Lovely shot! Bumrah goes full from around the stumps, angling in on middle and leg. Ben Duckett with a short back lift, brings it down to play with the angle and creams it wide of mid on for a boundary.
BEATEN! Outswinger, on a back of a length, outside off. Zak Crawley has a tentative poke at it, and the ball beats the bat.

That has stung Rishabh Pant behind the stumps! Outside off, on a fuller length, nips away a touch. Zak leaves and the ball reaches the keeper on the bounce. Pant gets low to grab the ball to his right, but is hit on the exposed area, just above the knee roll.
Angling onto the pads, Ben Duckett gets across to flick it away, but misses. The ball deflects off his thigh pad and rolls behind the square on the leg side. They get a leg bye.
Singles just keep coming for England! Inswinger on a fuller length, on middle and leg. Zak Crawley clips this all along the turf for a single at deep mid-wicket.
Good length, just outside off, cut away off the back foot to deep point for a single.

Ahh, this curves sharply back into the batter, on a length. Ben Duckett is caught off guard and with less space to work with. Tries to work this across, but misses and is hit high on the thigh pad. The ball rolls behind to the gully region.
Goes around the stumps, on a hard length, outside off, Ben Duckett slashes it off the back foot and gets a single at deep backward point. 6 runs off this Bumrah over.
Nagging length, shaping in on off, Ben Duckett pins this to the leg side.

Another couple! Fuller one, on off, Ben Duckett pushes it off the inner half of the bat and the ball goes between mid-wicket and square leg. Ravindra Jadeja is after it from the inner ring as the batters scamper for the second. They look for the third but Jadeja is quick enough to pick and throw it back to the bowler. Just two then.
Straighter and on the stumps, fuller in length. Ben Duckett flicks this to deep backward square leg for a quick couple of runs.
Speared outside leg, on a length. Ben Duckett gets inside the line and misses to whip that away.
England keep chipping away with these singles! Fullish, on off, Zak Crawley opens the bat face and guides this past backward point for a single. England now need 250 runs to win.
Back of a length, on top of off, Ben Duckett gets right behind the line and bunts it on the pitch.
Full and angling in on off, Zak Crawley gets forward to block, but it goes off the inside half to deep backward square leg for a single.
Nagging length, just outside off, Zak Crawley presses ahead and defends it out.
Sprayed down leg, on a good length. Zak Crawley misses the flick and the ball goes to the left of Pant who dives and stops to his left.
JAFFA! This one angles in and moves away from off, on a fullish length. Zak Crawley brings his bat in front to block, but plays inside the line and is beaten past the outside edge.

BEATEN! Shaping in from outside off, on a length. Lands and stays low a touch. Zak Crawley draws his front foot out to work that to cover, but misses. It passes just above the off pole and Pant dives to his left to collect it.
Length ball, on middle and leg, pushed to mid on.

A huge LBW appeal from Bumrah and the Indians, but the umpire denies. Possibly going down leg and Bumrah, by his expressions, he knows it. After a streak of balls outside off, he angles this into the batter, on a fuller length. Zak Crawley looks to work that across but plays all over it and the ball thuds on the front pad. The batters sneak a leg bye in as the ball rolls wide of point.
Keeps the line of attack outside off, on a hard length. Zak Crawley shoulders arms.
Some lateral movement, outside off, on a good length. Zak Crawley offers no shot. The ball curves away behind the stumps and Pant dives to grab it on the bounce to his right.
Pitched outside off, on a length, nibbling away, left alone by Zak.
Tap and run! Back of a length, moving a shy bit away from off, Ben Duckett lets the ball arrive and taps it on its head to backward point for a single.
Bowls full and on the off stump, Zak Crawley pushes this firmly to mid on. England need 254 runs to win, with all 10 wickets intact. And that will be LUNCH ON DAY 5!
Fuller in length, speared on off, Zak Crawley presses forward and blocks right under his eyes.
A slight inward curve on it, on a nagging length, Ben Duckett works this behind square on the leg side for a single.
Full and on off, Ben Duckett gets behind it to defend.
Full and straigth on off, Ben blocks it watchfully.
Mohammed Siraj is back on and begins with a length ball, on off, Ben Duckett tucks it to the leg side, just beside the pitch.

FOUR BYES! Salt on wounds! Down the leg stump, on a shortish length. Zak Crawley misses to lay his bat on the ball and it rises with the bounce to beat the dive of Pant and races down to deep fine leg.

How close was that? Hands on heads behind the stumps. Angles it into the batter, does Bumrah, with some bounce on it. Zak Crawley chips it straight and flat to the bowler. The ball arrives at knots to Jasprit Bumrah who bends low to his left. Even gets his left hand on the ball, but since it hit his wrist, it goes down. So, a chance put down. A tough one, though.

Bumrah goes for an inswinging yorker on off, but slips in a low full toss, Ben Duckett crouches and drives it with a straight bat, past mid off. Mohammed Siraj from short cover sprints after the ball and stops it before the ropes. Three taken.

An appeal for LBW from Bumrah, but the umpire is unmoved. Bumrah looks at Gill, but they do not opt for a review. Back of a length, on that in-between length, nipping in. Ben Duckett gets across and tries to nudge it into the leg side, but plays over the line and is hit on the front thigh pad. Probably doing a bit too much to go down leg.
A visible outward movement from off, full in length. Ben Duckett presses ahead and stabs it to short cover.
A thin shape away from off, on a length. Ben Duckett solidly blocks it back.
Slows it up, full and on the stumps, Zak Crawley tries to sweep that away, but the ball gets sliced off the bat and pops onto his chest before dropping on the pitch.
Around off and full, Zak Crawley defends it off the inside half to short leg.
Full and tossed on middle, Zak eases it out to cover.
Nice and full, on off, defended on the front foot.
Drag the length, but darts it on off, Ben Duckett hangs back and punches this past the vacant mid off region for a single. Jadeja chases the ball through to the deep and keeps it to one.
Floated fuller, and around off, spinning in a touch, pushed into the leg side by Duckett.
Angles it into the batter now, on a length, Zak Crawley plays with a straight bat and pins this to mid-wicket. No movement whatsoever for Bumrah as well.
Hard length, around off, Zak Crawley with a confident front foot block.
Laser-straight on middle, full in length, worked across into the leg side.
Goes fuller again, does Bumrah, around off. Zak Crawley prods forward to push this into the off side, but gets it off the inner half of the bat as the ball rolls to mid on.
Over the stumps, full and straight on off, Crawley leans and pushes this back to the bowler.
Around the stumps, back of a length, outside off, Ben Duckett cuts it away to deep point for a single.
Tossed up, full in length, just around middle and off. Zak Crawley watchfully defends it out.
Floated fuller and on off, Zak Crawley leans on it and defends it straight.
Length, on middle, tucked with soft hands to short leg.
Duckett shows his cards early by switching his stance and Jadeja darts it on the leg stump line. Ben Duckett is through his reverse and hits off the toe end of the bat wide of point for a single.
Aims the off pole, full in length, clipped across to mid-wicket.
Around off, full, darted in, blocked straight back by Duckett.

Pitched fuller and outside off, cutting away. Zak Crawley presses ahead to drive through cover, but gets a thick, healthy outside edge that runs down to deep third. The man from deep backward point mops it up. Two taken.

STRAIGHT UP... Lands safe! Shortish delivery from Prasidh, nipping back in. Zak Crawley mistimes the pull shot, over mid-wicket, but luckily for him, the ball lands between the mid-wicket and the converging deep square leg fielder. Two taken.

Swing and a miss! Prasidh appeals for a caught behind, but not entertained by the umpire. Short of a length, jagging back into the batter from off. Zak Crawley shapes up to pull it across, but it stays a tad low and beats the inside edge.

FOUR! The 100 is up for England! That is a confident stroke! On the back of a length, just outside off, enough width for Zak to work with. He hits that on the rise and finds the gap through cover-point for a cracking boundary.
Hard length, on off, nipping back in. Zak Crawley nudges this to short mid-wicket.
On middle, on a length. Ben Duckett tucks this through mid-wicket for a single. Oh, no! Prasidh has overstepped here and it is a No Ball.
Fractionally full, just around off. Ben Duckett crouches and punches this straight to cover.
Fuller and outside off. Ben Duckett sits down on one knee and reverse sweeps it to the deep backward point fielder for a run.
Fuller and outside off, Zak Crawley drills this to the left of the bowler. Ravindra Jadeja dives on the follow-through to stop it but the ball evades him and rolls down to long off for a single.
Slower and fuller, on the off stump. Zak Crawley lunges forward and blocks it back to the bowler.
Around the stumps again. Floated fuller and on middle and leg. Zak Crawley presses forward to block. The ball goes off the inside edge to the left of backward short leg fielder who dives to stop it.
Shortish, just outside the off stump. Ben Duckett tucks it to the square leg region for a single.
Starts from around the stumps, does Jadeja, lands it on a length, outside off, punched off the back foot by Crawley to deep cover for a single.
Fuller, and on the off stump line. Ben Duckett clips it to deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs.

Bowls from a wider angle, but sprays it across the batter and down leg. Ben Duckett misses to flick that away. Rishabh Pant behind the stumps, flings himself to the right and grabs the ball while being airborne.

That one kicks off from the surface! Prasidh Krishna bowls it on a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett looks to drive that one but misses on the outside edge. Rishabh Pant did well behind the wicket to gather over his head.

Angles it further in from middle, on a length, Ben Duckett tucks this with soft hands towards the deep mid-wicket region. Sai Sudharsan sprints to his right from deep square leg and mops it up. Two taken.
On a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett mistimes the drive to the short cover fielder.
On off, tailing in a shy bit, Zak Crawley pushes this full ball to the left of mid on and pinches in a quick single.
On a full length, angling onto the pads. Zak Crawley clips it to the mid on region where Jasprit Bumrah runs to his right and keeps it to one.
Back of a length, going straight over top of off, Zak Crawley presses forward and knocks it to point.

FOUR! Nicely driven by Zak Crawley! Shardul Thakur serves it on a fuller length and around the off-stump line. Zak Crawley strides forward and gets into a nice position to drive it through cover for a boundary.
Aims the sticks, does Shardul, on a length, Crawley flicks this to short mid-wicket.

FIFTY up for Ben Duckett! Excellent start for him, and he will be looking to convert this into a big one! Shardul Thakur bowls it on the back of a length, angling onto the pads. Ben Duckett tucks it away to deep square leg for a single to bring up his half century.
Around the stumps, good length, angling in on off. Ben Duckett nudges this straight to short mid-wicket.
On the back of a length, outside off. Ben Duckett stays back and guides it to deep backward point for a one. Good over for England as 9 runs come from it.

FOUR! This is going to frustrate Shubman Gill a lot! A short ball, outside off, nipping in. Ben Duckett swivels and pulls this behind square on the leg side for a boundary at deep backward square leg.
Goes fuller, just outside the off stump. Ben Duckett fends it to mid on.

Oh, trying to be a bit adventurous there! He is usually good at playing those scoops, but has failed to execute them twice today. Yard behind full and outside off, angling in. Ben Duckett shuffles a long way across to play the scoop shot, but mistimes it off the toe end and it hits his right bicep before rolling onto the pitch.
Good comeback from Prasidh Krishna! Bowls it on a good length, outside off. Ben Duckett throws his hands toward it but gets beaten on the outside edge.

FOUR! That is a classic cricketing stroke! Touch full from 'Skiddy', around off, Ben Duckett leans onto the ball and neatly times this between mid off and cover for a boundary. Holds the pose after completing the shot as well. He has looked really confident from the first ball.
Bowls it on a good length, on off. Zak Crawley drives it straight back to the bowler.
Shortish delivery, but angling on the pads, from around the stumps. Ben Duckett steers this down to deep fine leg for a single.
On the back of a length, angling onto the off stump. Ben Duckett rocks back and blocks it to the cover region.
Shade outside off, on a length, Zak Crawley rises with the bounce and guides it to deep backward point for a single. ENGLAND NEED 300 RUNS TO WIN NOW!
On a back of a length, angling on middle and leg. Ben Duckett clips it to deep backward square leg for one.

Quick tap and run and it is cheered by the crowd! Short of a good length, on off, Zak Crawley presses forward and stabs the ball on the pitch. It bounces and rolls behind towards the slips. Duckett is already through for a single and Crawley puts his skates on to reach to the other end before one of the slip fielders runs forward and picks the ball.
FOUR! Pulled away nicely! Prasidh Krishna serves it short in length, angling onto the off stump. Ben Duckett stays on the back foot and pulls it along the ground to the left of mid on for a boundary.
Attacks the off pole, does Krishna, nipping in off the deck. Zak Crawley prods forward to defend, but gets an inside edge and the ball rolls behind square on the leg side for a single.
On the back of a length, angling into the batter. Zak Crawley looks to flick that one but gets an inside edge and wears it high on the thigh pad.
Hard length, over the top of off, Zak Crawley gets forward and blocks it straight back to the bowler.
Bowls it on a good length, just outside off. Zak Crawley gets forward and looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge to gully.
Nagging length, angling on the pads, Zak Crawley misses to flick that away and is hit on the front pad.
Lands it on a full length, angling on middle and leg. Zak Crawley clips it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
At the stumps, on a length, Zak Crawley whips it firmly but Karun Nair at short mid-wicket gets low to his left to cut it off.
On a nagging length, on off, Zak Crawley dabs it down on the off side.
Too straight from Thakur again, on a back of a length, Ben Duckett tucks it off the pads to deep mid-wicket for one.
FOUR! Loosner from Shardul Thakur gets punished! Shardul Thakur serves it on a fuller length and slants on the pads from around the wicket. Ben Duckett flicks it to fine leg for a boundary.

Starts with a full ball, on off, Zak Crawley pushes it down the ground with a straight bat and sets off for a quick single. Ravindra Jadeja is quick to his left at mid on and also scores a direct hit at the bowling end but Crawley is in.
FOUR! Prasidh Krishna serves it on a fuller length and wide outside off stump. Ben Duckett leans forward and throws his hands to drive it between mid-off and cover for a boundary.
Ambitious attempt! On a good length, outside off, Ben Duckett walks across his stumps and goes for the scoop but fails to connect.
On a good length, angling into the batter. Ben Duckett comes on the front foot and blocks it.
Another play and a miss! Bowled from wide of the crease, on the fuller side, Ben goes for the flashy drive away from his body and gets beaten as the ball nips away.

FOUR BYES! 50 up for England! Prasidh Krishna bowls it on the good length, just outside the off stump. Ben Duckett shoulder arms at it, and it doesn't bounce much.  Rishabh Pant bends low and gets his body behind it to collect the ball, but gets a bad bounce in front of him, and it goes over his right leg to the fence behind for a four byes. Can't blame the keeper there, but India cannot afford such freebies.
Beaten! Pitched up from around the wicket, just outside off, Ben Duckett has a fiddle at the delivery away from his body and gets beaten on the outside edge.
On the good length, outside off. Zak Crawley leans forward and looks to drive it, but mistimes it to the mid off region.
On a back of a length, on off, Ben Duckett punches it towards cover where Shardul Thakur makes a half-stop. They cross.

Zak Crawley survives! Angling into the right-hander, on a good length, on middle, Crawley walks across his stumps and also takes a couple of steps down the track. Has a swipe across the line but gets beaten on the inside edge and gets hit on the back leg. A leg bye is taken as the ball rolls behind on the leg side. Shubman Gill asks a couple of questions to the men behind the bat - first, if there is any bat and secondly, if it is doing too much? Gill takes the review with a couple of seconds left on the timer. This looks close on the replays. There is no bat involved on UltraEdge but the Ball Tracking shows that the impact is more than 3 metres and the ball is going past the leg stump. India lose a review.
On off, on a good length, Zak Crawley is solid in defence.
Good length, on the off stump line. Zak Crawley blocks it to mid-wicket.
Shaping in a touch, on off, on a length, Zak Crawley knocks it to mid on with a straight bat.

Bowls from a wider angle, slants it on the fuller length, swinging onto the stumps. Ben Duckett drives it back to the bowler. Prasidh Krishna on his follow-through, gets his hand on the ball, and it deflects on the stump but Crawley has his bat inside the crease.

FOUR! Not in full control but Ben Duckett will take it! Prasidh Krishna errs in line and offers width on off, on a back of a length, Duckett throws his hands at the ball. Gets a thickish outside edge that flies well over the man at gully.
Comes from around the wicket and bowls it on the back of a length, angling into the batter. Ben Duckett drives it to cover.
Full and on middle, clipped behind square on the leg side for a single.
On a length, on middle and off. Zak Crawley works it to mid on.
Nails the yorker first up and the ball moves away in the air, on off, Zak Crawley gets his bat down in time to keep it out.
On a back of a length, on off. Ben Duckett prods forward and defends it back to the bowler.
Length-delivery, just outside off, punched solidly to the cover fielder.
On a nagging length, angling into the batter. Ben Duckett gets on the front foot and fends it to the leg side.

FOUR! Just past the fielder! A full ball from Siraj, angling in from off, with some bounce. Ben Duckett prods forward to cream the cover drive, but due to that extra bounce, the ball hits the upper part of the bat, just below the sticker, and is chipped to the right of mid on. The fielder dives full-stretch to his right but the ball evades him and races down the ground for a boundary.
On the back of a length, on the off stump line. Zak Crawley taps it to the backward point region for a single.
Full and on off, Zak Crawley gets a good stride in and pushes it to mid off.
Pitches it on the full length, outside off. Ben Duckett once again looks to drive but mistimes it straight back to the bowler.
On a back of a length, outside off, this keeps a bit low, Ben Duckett slashes at the ball but gets it off the toe end of the bat towards gully.
Bowls fuller, angling onto the off stump. Ben Duckett looks to drive that one but gets the inner half of the bat to mid on.
A bit wide on off, on a length, Ben Duckett thought about going after it but eventually bailed out of the shot and withdrew his bat.
Lands it on the full length, on the fifth stump line. Ben Duckett prods forward to block it back to the bowler.
On off, on a back of a length, Ben Duckett stands tall and dabs it beside the pitch on the off side.

A loud shout for LBW but that looked high! The sharp nip-backer from Siraj, on a back of a length, on middle, Zak is already standing outside the crease and looks to work it away on the leg side with a closed bat face. Gets beaten on the inside edge and catches it high on the thigh pad.
Delivers it on the line of the off stump, on a length, Crawley taps it to mid off along the ground.
Honing in on the front pad, a bit full, Zak Crawley presents a straight bat and eases it to mid on.
Keeps it on off, on a length, Zak Crawley is standing outside the crease to negate the movement and manages to push it to mid off.

Wow! Wobble-seam delivery by Siraj from over the wicket, on a good length, outside the off stump, Crawley walks closer to the line of the ball to drive it away. The ball jags back in and keeps a bit low as well to cut Zak in half, before sneaking through the gap between bat and the pad. It passes just above the off pole, and Rishabh Pant dives low to his left to gather it. Pant appeals for a caught behind and seeing him, Siraj too chips in a slight enquiry, but the umpire shakes his head. A pearler of a delivery nonetheless.
Slanting in on a back of a length, on middle, Duckett hops and tucks it to deep square leg for one.
Attacking the off stump, on a length, Ben nudges it off the front foot down to deep backward square leg for a single.
Fractionally wide, on a back of a length, Duckett dabs it with a horizontal bat but straight to backward point.
Not that wide for the cut, on a short of a length, Ben Duckett hangs back and frees his arms for the cut but ends up chopping it down beside him.

On the fuller side, around off, Zak Crawley just leans into the drive and does not try to hit it too hard. Just times it through point. Ravindra Jadeja goes after it from backward point and puts in a slide to prevent the ball from reaching the fence. Flicks the ball away from the fence but by then, the batters run three.

First ball that has kept a bit low today! In the channel on off, on a back of a length, Zak Crawley shoulders arms. The ball goes on the bounce to Rishabh Pant who gets his body behind the ball and manages to make the stop.
Bumrah to Crawley for the first time today! On a good length, on off, Zak plays it back to the bowler with a straight bat.

Spears in a full ball, on off, Zak Crawley sets up to drive it down the ground. The bat turns in his hand and it rolls off the inner half in front of mid on. Prasidh Krishna is caught on his heels there and Crawley pinches a quick single.
Fuller, on off, Crawley eases it off the front foot to cover.

First sign of aggression from England! This is on a good length, outside off, Zak Crawley premeditatedly walks across the stumps and tries to play the pick-up shot. Has a swipe across the line but the ball is not full enough and Crawely gets beaten on the outside edge.
In the corridor of off, a bit of inward movement off the deck, on a good length, Zak Crawley blocks it out solidly off the front foot.
Lands it on a length, on off, Crawley pats it off the front foot towards cover.
Pitched up by Siraj, on off, Zak opens the bat face slightly, gets forward and guides it through point. Ravindra Jadeja sprints to his right from deep backward point and mops it up. Two runs taken.

NO BALL! Seaming back in, on a length, on middle, Zak Crawley takes a step towards the ball and tries to push it down the ground with a straight bat. Gets an inside edge on the front pad. Siraj has overstepped.

Another full ball, aimed at the sticks, Ben Duckett brings his wrists into play and clips it well but can't get it past Shardul Thakur at a shortish square leg. England have been watchful so far, but at the same time, India’s bowling has been disciplined, and the batters have shown due respect to it.
Slightly fuller, on the off stump, Ben Duckett plants his front foot forward and wristily plays it to mid on.
Continues to hone in around the off stump, on a nagging length, Ben Duckett stays back and defends it close to his body.
Attacking the stumps from around the wicket, on a length, Duckett brings his bat at an angle and works it towards mid-wicket.
On a good length, on off, Ben Duckett waits back and eases it to cover.

Beaten! Just outside the off stump, on a good length, Ben Duckett is forced to play at it due to the angle. Brings his bat out in front and there is not much movement off the deck but the ball kicks up to whistle past the outside edge.
On the shorter side, on off, Ben gets on top of the bounce and knocks it wide of cover for a single.
Bashes the hard length, on off, Ben Duckett gets behind the line and stabs it down the deck.
Angling into the left-hander, on middle, on a short of a length, Ben Duckett hops and jabs it along the ground to mid on.
On middle and leg, on a nagging length, Ben Duckett tucks it to the man at mid-wicket.
Switches to around the wicket for the left-hander and pulls the length back slightly, on off, Duckett guides it towards gully.
Zeroining in on the front pad, on a length, Zak Crawley presents a straight bat out in front. Ekes out an inside edge that rolls through square leg for a single.

An absolute beauty by Bumrah to end the day's first over! This angles in and then nips away late from the left-hander, on off, on a good length, Ben Duckett is squared up completely and even Rishabh Pant is moving to his right, expecting the ball to go on with the angle. The ball zips past the outside edge and Pant stretches out his left hand and dives to make the stop.
Just outside the off stump, on a nagging length, Ben Duckett covers the line of the ball and pats it to mid on with a straight bat.

Bowled from slightly wide of the crease, slanting into the pads, on a good length, Duckett misses out on the tickle. Zak Crawley wants to sneak in a leg bye as the ball rolls in front of square leg but Ben sends him back.

FOUR! Ben Duckett and England are underway on Day 5! Bumrah serves it on a back of a length, outside off, Ben hangs on the back foot and rides the bounce nicely. Punches it all along the ground through covers for a boundary.
Hits the deck hard and hurls it on a hard length, on off, Ben hangs back and dabs it down the deck whilst taking the bottom hand off the handle of the bat.
Starts from around the wicket and lands it on a good length, around off, Ben Duckett watchfully pushes it to short cover.
Around off, on a length, Crawley presses forward to stab it beside the pitch on the off side. That will be STUMPS on Day 4!
Speared in, on off, a bit full, Zak defends it with a straight bat.
Full and sliding on with the arm, on middle, Zak Crawley blocks it out off the front foot.
Very full, aiming at the rough outside the off stump, Ben Duckett plants his front foot across and plays the paddle past the man at backward short leg for one.
A hint of turn, on the fuller side, outside off, Zak gets a good stride in and pushes it to the left of cover for one more.
Jadeja begins from over the wicket and lands it short, around off, Ben Duckett walks across and gets closer to the line. Flicks it through square leg for a single.
Sliding down leg, on a nagging length, Zak Crawley misses the tickle.

On middle, on a length, Ben Duckett makes use of the angle and wrists it to the left of mid on. The ball gets past the despairing dive of Mohammed Siraj at mid on. Sai Sudharsan from mid-wicket puts in a chase and manages to pull it back in. Three runs taken.

Pitched up, on off, Ben shows the full face of the bat and just pushes it to the left of the bowler. Jasprit Bumrah sticks out his left hand but the ball goes under the hand and races past Mohammed Siraj at mid on to his right. Siraj goes after it and cuts it off with a slide. Two runs taken.
Slightly fuller, outside off, Duckett watchfully lets it go.
Nearly dragged it back onto the stumps! On a length, outside off, Ben leaves his bat hanging and gets an inside edge onto the back thigh.

Jasprit Bumrah comes from around the wicket for the first time in the innings for Ben Duckett. Lands it just outside the off stump, on a good length, Duckett is a bit tentative on the shot and ekes out an inside edge onto the pads.
Goes fuller this time, around the sixth stump, Zak Crawley has his off stump covered whilst making the leave.
Corrects his line, does Siraj. This nips back a bit, on middle, on a nagging length, Zak stays on the back foot to deal with it and gets beaten on the inside edge to wear it high on the thigh pad.
FOUR! Flayed away! Too wide this time, on a back of a length, Crawley gets the width he needs and he throws his hands at the ball. Gets it up and over backward point for four more.
FOUR! Lovely shot! Siraj gets his line wrong. Sprays a length ball, on the pads, Zak brings his wrists into play and flicks it between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.

Chance? Did that carry? Full and swinging away, outside off, Zak Crawley cashes in on the width and creams the drive. It lands just short of Sai Sudharsan at diving in front and the ball hits him just above the wrist.
On a back of a length, on off, Duckett gets on his toes and punches it to deep point for a single.
This seams away sharply off the deck and kicks up a bit but well outside off and Crawley offers no shot.
Indecision! Just outside the off stump, on a good length, Zak Crawley is a bit late to withdraw his bat. Leaves his bat hanging and the ball rolls off the toe end of the bat towards the slip cordon.
Zeroing in on the front pad, on a good length, Zak brings his bat out in front and pushes it to mid on.
Bowled from slightly wide of the crease, on the off stump, on a good length, Zak Crawley defends it right under his eyes.
On the pads, on a length, Ben turns it to the right of deep fine leg and gets off the mark with a single.
This is pushed across the left-hander from over the wicket by Bumrah, on a good length, Ben Duckett lets the ball go past him.
Mohammed Siraj starts with a maiden! Nice and full, just outside the off stump, Zak Crawley is solid in defence.
Jagging back in, on a good length, on off, Crawley adjusts to the inward movement and tucks it to mid-wicket off the front foot.
Hurls it on a short of a length, on the line of the off stump, Zak Crawley stands tall and pats it to mid on with a straight bat.
Fuller in length and moving away in the air, not close enough to make the batter play and Zak is happy to leave that alone.
On a nagging length, on top of off, Zak Crawley hangs back and looks to keep it out with soft hands. The ball rolls off the outer half towards backward point.
In the channel on off, on a good length, swinging away, Crawley leaves the ball alone.
Risky leave! Ben Duckett expects the ball to go across him with the angle but this shapes back in late and Ben does not have his off stump covered. Sees the ball zipping past the off pole.
On the fuller side, on off, Crawley pushes a bit out in front with a straight bat. Gets it off the outer half and it dribbles past backward point for a single.
Zak Crawley and England are underway! A bit too straight, on the pads, on a good length, Zak clips it off the pads to the left of deep backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Just around the off stump, on a good length, slanting in and then moving away late, Zak Crawley leaves the ball alone.
Slanting in at the pads, on a nagging length, Zak misses the flick and wears it high on the front pad. An optimistic shout for LBW but that was always going down leg.
Bumrah steams in from over the wicket and gets a hint of away shape, outside off, on a good length, Zak Crawley shoulders arms.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND TAKEN! Expertly held by Josh Tongue and that's that for the Indian innings! Nicely tossed up by Bashir, on a nagging length, around off, Prasidh sees the ball above his eyeline and goes for the heave across the line. Skies it up towards deep mid-wicket where Josh Tongue is in off the ropes and is looking into the sun. Judges well and puts a late dive to his left to take the catch. He manages to hold on even as his elbow hits the ground. Bashir finishes with 2 wickets. India end with a lead of 370!
Prasidh Krishna c J Tongue b S Bashir 0 (11b 0x4 0x6)
This keeps straight, on a nagging length, Prasidh Krishna lunges and plays for the turn. Defends inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.
Loopy delivery, on off, Ravindra gets forward to steer it through point for a single.
This lands on the footmarks outside the off stump and scoots through. Ravindra Jadeja leaves it alone.
Fired wide on off, Jadeja lets it be.

Turning away, on a nagging length, around off, Ravindra Jadeja reaches out in front for the paddle but misses as the ball spins away to go past the bat. Catches him on the left shoulder and it goes down to deep third but Jadeja does not take the single.
On a hard length, on top of off, Prasidh Krishna presses back and gets on top of the bounce to defend.

Fuller in length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja pushes in front of his body with a straight bat. Gets an outside edge that dribbles down to deep third. Jadeja takes the single and leaves Krishna one ball to face.
On off, on a nagging length, Ravindra Jadeja drops it beside the pitch on the off side.

FOUR! More runs! Josh bangs it in short, around leg, Ravindra Jadeja stands tall and swivels to roll his wrists over the ball. Pulls it all along the ground to the left of deep square leg for a four. India's lead grows to 368!

SIX! Clobbered! From around the wicket, on a good length, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja makes use of the angle and clubs it across the line. Hits it for a flat six between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket.
On a short of a length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja glides it down to deep third with an open bat face but does not run.
Banged in short, outside off, Prasidh Krishna sways away and lets it be. The ball dies down on its way to the keeper but Jamie Smith does well to move to his right and gathers it on the bounce.
Fuller and on off, Prasidh Krishna pats it to the left of cover but they do not run.
On a length, on middle, pushed to long on for a single by Jadeja.

Did that carry? Just not enough! On a nagging length, around leg, Ravindra Jadeja picks it up off the pads and hits it aerially towards deep square leg where Ben Duckett is late to pick up the trajectory of the descending ball. Runs in off the ropes and puts in a dive but the ball lands just short. The ball brushes his hands after bouncing and rolls behind but the batters do not cross over.
Slower and fuller, on middle, flicked to deep mid-wicket but Ravindra Jadeja refuses the single.
Angling in, on a back of a length, tucking the batter up for room, Ravindra Jadeja steps out but is cramped for room and just bunts it into the deck.
On the fuller side, aimed at the sticks, Prasidh Krishna gets right behind it to defend.
Slanting in, on a good length, on middle and leg, Prasidh Krishna covers the line and keeps it out on the leg side.
Short and wide on off, Ravindra Jadeja flays at the ball. Gets a thickish outside edge down to deep third and Jadeja crosses over.
On a short of a length, on off, Jadeja guides it down to deep third but does not run.

Angling into the pads, on a back of a length, Ravindra Jadeja walks across to swat it away but misses. The ball lobs off the thigh pad towards backward square leg and Prasidh Krishna sets off, thinking they can come back for the second but Jadeja sends him back.
On off, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja lunges and eases it to deep point. Does not take the single.
On a back of a length, outside off. Prasidh Krishna shoulders arms at it.
Beaten! On a length, angling in and then it straightens off the deck, Krishna brings his bat out in front to block but gets beaten on the outside edge.
On a full length, just outside off. Ravindra Jadeja drives it to long off for a single. 350 up for India!

Slower one from Woakes, on a length, sliding onto the pads, Ravindra Jadeja walks inside the line and looks to swipe it behind square on the leg side. Gets deceived by the slowness of the ball and is early into the shot. Gets a soft leading edge to cover.
Bowls it on a good length, just around that middle and off stump line. Ravindra Jadeja stays leg side and makes some room to play it towards the off side, but fends it off the pitch.
Angling in from around the wicket, on a length, on off, Jadeja pushes it in front of long off but does not take the single.
On a good length, angling onto the pads. Prasidh Krishna looks to play it on the leg side but wears it on the pads. A triple-wicket maiden from Josh Tongue.
Gets the yorker in, on off, Prasidh Krishna gets low and squeezes it out towards backward point.

OUT! DRAGGED ON! Three wickets in four balls for Josh Tongue and India are folding quickly here. Pitched up by Josh, on off, Bumrah keeps his front leg out of the way and swings to go down the ground. Gets an inside edge that goes back onto uproot the middle stump. Stokes is delighted. From 333/4, India have slipped to 349/9.
Jasprit Bumrah b J Tongue 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)
Safely negotiated by Bumrah! On a good length, on middle and leg, Jasprit Bumrah brings his bat out in front to block it beside the pitch on the leg side.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Two in two for Josh Tongue! A painful duck for Mohammed Siraj as he cops a blow on the right hand. He winces in pain as he walks off. A well-directed bumper from over the wicket at the right shoulder of the batter, Siraj hops to get inside the line and tries to help the pull behind square on the leg side. The ball gets big on him and catches him on the gloves. It lobs behind to the left of the keeper, Jamie Smith, who moves to that side and dives to snaffle it with ease. India lose their 8th wicket with a lead of 355 runs.
Mohammed Siraj c J Smith b J Tongue 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! EDGED AND TAKEN! Joe Root is not dropping those, but that took him by surprise, possibly because it came a bit quicker than he expected.
