A wicket nonetheless for England as Josh Tongue gets his first scalp. This is bowled fuller and just around the off stump line with some shape away from the batter. Shardul Thakur is drawn forward to play the cover drive, but gets a thick outside edge. The ball flies straight towards Joe Root stationed at the first slip. The ball goes quickly towards him, around his face level, but Root does well enough to cling on to it as he falls over. Shardul Thakur departs for 4 (12) and from 333/4, India have slipped to 349/7.
Shardul Thakur c J Root b J Tongue 4 (12b 0x4 0x6)
On a back of a length, wide outside off. Ravindra Jadeja lets it go.
Back of a length, Jadeja tucks this with soft hands to the leg side.
On a good length, angling in to the batter from outside off. Ravindra Jadeja prods forward to defend but gets beaten on the outside edge.

A wobbly-seam delivery, just outside off, on a fuller length with some bounce. Ravindra Jadeja presses forward to block but gets an inside edge and the ball rolls on the surface off the inner thigh pad.
Lands it on a short of a length, outside off. Ravindra Jadeja leaves it alone to the keeper.

A bit of yes and no there! But no harm done! Around the stumps, full and on off, angling in. Ravindra Jadeja leans forward and knocks the ball to the cover region. He is off for a single, but Shardul shows no interest, and Jadeja turns around to retreat back to the crease, as the cover fielder moves to his left and gets to the ball.
On the back of a length, angling into the batter. Shardul Thakur looks to clip it to the leg side but gets an inside edge on the pads.
Aimed at the off stump, with an inward angle, fuller in length, Shardul presses forward and blocks it to the off side.
On off, on a nagging length, RJ steers it to deep backward point and crosses over.
FOUR! Lovely stroke! Overpitched from Tongue, swinging in from middle, Ravindra Jadeja gets on the front foot and flicks this through the vacant mid on region for a boundary.
Outside off, on a good length, left alone by Jadeja.
Fires a low full toss, tailing in, Ravindra Jadeja misses his flick and is rapped on the front pad. A muted LBW appeal, but the angle is taking the ball down leg, quite possibly.
Fuller and on middle, whipped on the bounce to mid on by Thakur.
Angled into the pads, on a length, flicked through mid-wicket for one more.
On a back of a length, on off, Thakur pushes it to deep cover and crosses over.

A nervy single there! Back of a length, outside the off stump. Ravindra Jadeja hops and drops this in front of Bashir at backward point and rushes for a single. Bashir is quick to pick up and throw at the batting end but misses and Shardul gets home by sliding his bat inside the crease.
Pitched up, outside off, driven to deep point for a single by Shardul.
Whoa, a very tight leave! Nagging length, angling over the top of off, Shardul Thakur gets forward and decides to leave that alone. The ball passes scaringly just above the off pole.
On off, on a length, eased to deep cover for a single by Shardul.
NO BALL! Full and on off, Shardul knocks it to mid off. Carse has overstepped.
Angles in around off, and then shapes away, on a nagging length. Shardul Thakur gets half forward and drags the bat inside the line to leave it.
On a short of a length, just outside off. Ravindra Jadeja gets on top of the bounce and guides it to deep third for a single.

Touch full and on middle, tailing in. Shardul Thakur flicks this to the right of mid-wicket and sets off for a single. The fielder is quick to pick and release the throw to the bowling end, but misses to score the direct hit. Shardul rushes to get to the other end, by sliding his bat in.
Bowls it on good length, shaping away from outside off. Shardul Thakur shoulders arms at it.
Back of a length, at the stumps, nudged into the leg side for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT AND BOWLED! A soft, soft dismissal and Karun Nair stands stunned as he cannot quite believe it. Chris Woakes bowls it straight and full, on off, Karun Nair taps the front foot out and tries to play the straight drive. Hits it well enough, but does not manage to keep it along the ground, and it goes flat and parallel to the ground to the bowler. Chris Woakes takes a good return catch on his follow-through around his right thigh, and Karun Nair departs on 20. India are 336/6, leading by 342.
Karun Nair c&b C Woakes 20 (54b 3x4 0x6)
A slight shape away from outside off, Karun prods forward and leaves it alone.
On a nagging length, just around the off stump line. Karun Nair taps it to the gully region.
Cannons it in front of the stumps, on a hard length, a solid back foot punch from Karun into the off side.
On a good length, angling onto the off stump. Ravindra Jadeja gets on the front foot to defend it but gets an inside edge to square leg for a single. He gets off the mark with that one.
Nagging length, on off, angling in from around the stumps. Ravindra Jadeja is caught cramped for room and manages to only fend on the pitch.
Lands it on a short of a length, outside off. Karun Nair lets it go to the keeper.

A loud appeal for LBW, but not given! Brydon Carse spears this into the batter, angling in from off, on a fullish length. Ravindra Jadeja gets a bit too across to flick that into the leg side, but plays over the line and is hit on the front pad. The ball lobs off the pad and drops in front of mid-wicket, as the batters cross over for a leg bye. Possibly did too much to go down the leg stump and hence, Stokes does not review it.
Bowls it on a back of a length, angling into the batter. Ravindra Jadeja looks to clip it to the leg side but misses it and wears it off the thigh pad. The ball rolls toward cover.
Fractional full and on off, defended it on the off side.

OUT! DRAGGED ON! A marathon knock from KL Rahul comes to an end. An inning of patience, grit, and he has put his vast experience to good use for his side. Gets a warm applause from the crowd as he walks back to the dressing room. Coming to the delivery, Brydon Carse keeps the line of attack outside the off stump and gets the ball to jag back in a bit on a good length, with some extra bounce as well. KL Rahul is caught off guard with the lift as he tries to cut it on the rise, but ends up playing it tentatively and from close to the body. Gets an inside edge and the ball smashes back into the stumps.  Rahul falls for 137 (247) with India's lead being 339.
KL Rahul b B Carse 137 (247b 18x4 0x6)
Short of a length, outside off. Karun Nair gets on top of the bounce and taps it to backward point for a quick single. Umpire signals that it was a NO BALL as Carse had overstepped.
Hits the deck hard, does Carse, short and around off, Karun Nair presses this down on the pitch.

FOUR! Fine shot from KL Rahul! Chris Woakes bowls it on the back of a length and outside off stump. KL Rahul goes back in his crease and cuts it late to the left of backward point. The fielder from the deep runs to his right but fails to stop the boundary.
Fuller and outside off, left alone by KL.
Back of a length, outside off. KL Rahul defends it back to the bowler.
Whoa! That has taken KL Rahul by surprise! Angling towards the off pole, on a length. It lands and cuts away and KL Rahul bails out after prodding half forward.
On a back of a length, on off, stabbed down on the off side.
That in-between length, outside off, dabbed off the back foot to the left of backward point for a quick single.

On a good length, angling on to the off stumps. Karun Nair drops his bat at the last moment due to the extra bounce, and it hits him on the gloves. The ball rolls to the backward point region. Single taken.
Back of a length, on off, punched down on the pitch.

Short of a length, angling back into the batter. Karun Nair looks to clip it to the leg side but misses it and wears it on the pad. An appeal of LBW from Brydon Carse, but it looks like it was going down leg.
A harmless delivery, wide of off, on a back of a length, Karun Nair shoulders arms.

FOUR! Brydon Carse bowls it on a fuller length and well wide outside the off stump. Karun Nair sees the width and leans forward to drive it away from his body. Gets a thick outside edge that flies over Ben Duckett, who is standing at gully.
PEACH! Bangs the surface hard, outside off, Karun Nair goes fishing at it on the back foot, playing it away from the body, and gets beaten as the ball nips away.
On a good length, outside off. KL Rahul blocks it to short mid-wicket.

Pitched fuller and on off, Karun Nair drives it straight down the ground to the left of the bowler. Ben Stokes from mid off sprints to the deep and stops the ball before the ropes. Just a single then.
On a good length and in the corridor on off. Swinging away from the batter. Karun Nair looks to defend but gets beaten on the outside edge.
BEATEN! Brings the ball closer, in the corridor of doubt, around off and full. It lands and straightens. Karun Nair plays inside the line and gets beaten past the outside edge.
A bit closer to the off stump, but still, fairly wide, Karun Nair prods forward, watches closely and then leaves.
Not much swing for Woakes. On a length, outside off, too wide to play at and Karun leaves.
Short and outside off, Karun Nair punches this off the back foot, and gets a single at deep cover. India lead by 326 runs!
Hits the deck hard, on top of off, Karun Nair gets on the back foot and punches it on the pitch.
WIDE! This one swings well across the tramline on the off side. Karun shoulders arms. Wide called.
Full and moving away from off, Karun lets it be.

FOUR! Classic! Right out of the coach's manual! Speared fuller and on the fourth stump line, nibbling away. Karun Nair, with a straight bat face, times the drive down the ground for a boundary. Didn't try to hit it too hard, just pure timing.
Gets some outswing, does Brydon. Full, outside off, shaping away late. Karun Nair leaves that alone.
A short delivery with the new ball, on off, Karun Nair hops on and dabs it on the pitch.
Short, outside off, KL Rahul is flummoxed with the extra bounce, but does well to open the bat face and dab it along the ground to the gully region.
Quick tap and run! Floated up, full and outside off, Karun Nair gets on the front foot and eases it in front of the cover fielder and steals a single.
Nicely looped up, full and around off, Karun Nair jabs it across to the leg side.
Short, turning in from off, Karun Nair stands tall and tucks it to square leg.
Flighted fuller and on middle and leg, KL Rahul clips this with soft hands and jogs for a single as the ball rolls into mid-wicket.

FOUR! Beautiful shot! Picks the gap nicely, does Rahul! Just a bit too short, spinning in from outside off, KL Rahul picks the length in a trice, goes back and across and cuts it to deep backward point for a boundary.
Short of a good length, around off, bunted into the off side.
Fuller and outside off, KL Rahul leans on it and drives it to the deep cover region for a single.
Full and straight on off, driven straight back.

Sharp bumper from Stokes, on off and middle, KL Rahul swivels to pull, but gets an inside edge and the ball stings him on the hip bone and rolls on the pitch. KL Rahul rubs the bruised area, but is fine to continue.
Nagging length, on the stumps, KL Rahul blocks off the back foot.

FOUR! Nicely done! Good effort from Bashir, but in vain. Angled down the leg stump line, on a fractional fuller length. KL Rahul with a delicate flick and the ball travels along the turf to the deep fine leg region. Shoaib Bashir runs across to his right from deep backward square leg. He dives to stop the ball, but his knee gets slammed into the grass and the ball evades him into the fence.
Spins in sharply from that rough, outside off and full. Karun Nair watchfully defends it out.
Quick, flat and full, on the leg stump. KL Rahul steers this through square leg for a single.
Too slow, outside off, and full. KL Rahul draws his front foot out and steers it to square leg.
Full and quick, on off, Karun Nair looks to work that straight, but slices it to the cover region for a single.
Released too slow through the air, on off, Karun Nair defends this full ball right under the bat.
Not too full, not too short, outside off, Karun Nair hangs back and blocks it beside the pitch on the leg side.
Angling into the batter, on a length, around off. Karun Nair prods forward to block it straight but the ball catches the inside edge and rolls through the wide square leg region for a single.
Good length, outside off, Karun leaves this harmless delivery.
Nice and full, straight around off, Karun Nair drives it solidly to mid off.
Straight on off, full, Karun Nair blocks it right under his eyes.
Full in length, and the line of attack is outside the off stump. Rahul leans into the drive to deep cover for a single. THE 300 IS UP FOR INDIA!

An appeal for caught behind now. Jamie Smith looks a bit reluctant and Stokes too, is unsure whether the ball clipped the bat or grazed the thigh pad. Hence, they do not go for a review. This is down the leg side on a good length, KL Rahul misses to nudge it across and the ball dips low to the left of Jamie Smith who dives to his left to scoop the ball. UltraEdge confirms that there's a spike and that the sound is of the ball grazing the thigh pad.
Full and on off, reverse swept, but straight to point.
Another one that turns in from outside off, tucked across to the leg side by Karun.

Half an appeal for LBW, but Chris Gaffaney with a shake of his head. Drags the length back, pitches it outside off. It lands and takes a sharp bite into the batter. Karun Nair goes deep in the crease to block it out, but plays over it and gets hit high on the thigh pad. The impact clearly looked outside off and hence, Stokes did not go upstairs.
Tossed up fuller, on the stumps, Karun Nair leans in front to push it back to the bowler.
Some turn again, a yard behind fuller length, around off. Karun Nair negotiates it well by blocking off the back foot.
First runs after the Tea break. Over the stumps, on a length, spinning in from off. KL Rahul rocks back and tucks it wide of mid-wicket for a single.
Safely negotiated! Shorter and angling on middle, Karun Nair covers the line and punches it solidly off the back foot. India lead by 304 runs! And that will be TEA ON DAY 4!
Safely negotiated! Shorter and angling on middle, Karun Nair covers the line and punches it solidly off the back foot. And that will be TEA ON DAY 4!
Short and climbing over the batter, on off, Karun Nair arches back to let it pass through.
Angles it into the batter, on the shorter side, on top of middle and leg. Karun Nair hops across and tucks this to short mid-wicket.
Full and outside off, going straight on, Karun Nair shoulders arms at it.
Attacks the stumps, does Stokes, on a hard length. Karun Nair plays with a straight bat face and knocks it straight back to the bowler.
No run.
Back of a length, just outside off, coming straight on the batter. KL Rahul gets behind it and guides it to the point region for a single.
1 run.
FOUR! Karun Nair is off the mark in an adventurous fashion! Darted fuller and on off, Karun Nair switches his stance and reverse sweeps it past short third for a boundary. INDIA NOW LEAD BY 303 RUNS!

FOUR! Karun Nair is off the mark in an adventurous fashion! Darted fuller and on off, Karun Nair switches his stance and reverse sweeps it past short third for a boundary. India's lead is now 303 runs!
This one spins into the batter, on a length, on middle. KL Rahul plays with the spin and nudges this through mid-wicket for a single.
1 run.
Too slow through the air, sliding down the leg stump line, KL Rahul tickles it with soft hands to short fine leg.
Drags the length, and keeps it outside off, KL Rahul is quick to rock back and punches it to short cover.
Floated up, full and on middle and leg, KL Rahul dabs it across to short mid-wicket.
No run.
Full and turning in on middle. KL Rahul lets it come and eases it to the leg side, beside the strip.
No run.
Outside off, but the length is fuller, Karun Nair offers no shot.
No run.
Short of a good length, angling on the top of off. Karun Nair covers the line, watches it closely and lets it be.
No run.
Back of a length, with some lateral movement, outside off, Karun Nair is firm to shouldering arms at it.
No run.
Nagging length, outside off, left alone by Karun.
No run.

Shoots it outside off, on a length, KL Rahul hangs back and cuts it very late to the right of the gully fielder. Harry Brook makes a one-handed half stop by diving to his right. The ball rolls behind him and the batters cross over for a single.
1 run.
FOUR! KLASS! Short and wide of off, KL Rahul gets enough width and cuts it square, through the vacant point region for a cracking boundary.
Dropped fuller and flighted around off, Karun Nair carves it out to the left of mid on.
Fuller and on off, Nair leans forward to block it right under the eyes.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND TAKEN! Finally, finally, some respite for Ben Stokes and England. The whole of Headingley is on its feet to acknowledge this wonderful knock from a sheer entertainer! Shoaib Bashir bowls it flat and quick, a bit too full on the stumps, from around the stumps. Rishabh Pant premeditates it and gets low on his knees to slog. Perhaps the ball is too full and Pant does not get hold of it. Ends up airing it off the toe end of the bat and the ball sails straight down the throat of Zak Crawley at wide long on. Rishabh Pant departs for an entertaining 118 (140). India are 287/4, leading by 293 runs.
Rishabh Pant (wk) c Z Crawley b S Bashir 118 (140b 15x4 3x6)

OUT! IN THE AIR AND TAKEN! Finally, finally, some respite for Ben Stokes and England. The whole of Headingley is on its feet to acknowledge this wonderful knock from a sheer entertainer! Shoaib Bashir bowls it flat and quick, a bit too full on the stumps, from around the stumps. Rishabh Pant premeditates it and gets low on his knees to slog. Perhaps the ball is too full and Pant does not get hold of it. Ends up airing it off the toe end of the bat and the ball sails straight down the throat of Zak Crawley at wide long on. Rishabh Pant departs for an entertaining 118 (140). India are 287/4, leading by 293 runs.
Rishabh Pant (wk) c Z Crawley b S Bashir 118 (140b 15x4 3x6)
Darted on the stumps, too full, carved out to the bowler.
Full, outside off, a bit too wide for the reverse and Pant misses to connect.

IN THE AIR...Lands safe enough! Fuller and just outside off. Rishabh Pant is early on his knee to slog it over mid-wicket. Mistimes it in the air, as one hand comes off the handle but luckily for him, the ball lands to the left of the chasing long on fielder. Two taken.
No run.
2 runs.
Nice and full, floated up on middle, KL Rahul taps this across to the right of the bowler.
Length, on the off stump. Pant works it through square leg for a single.

FOUR! He is on the charge and is taking on every loosener thrown at him! Full and on the stumps, Rishabh Pant sits down on his knee and sweeps this powerfully towards the deep square leg region for a boundary.
Four!
SIX! Tonked! Sliding on with the arm from around the wicket, bowled with a flatter trajectory, on off, Rishabh reaches out and slams it over extra cover for a flat six.
Six!
FOUR! Up and over! Floated up, around off, Rishabh Pant puts the dancing shoes on and gets to the pitch of the ball. Thumps it back over the bowler's head for a four.
Four!

FOUR BYES! Root tosses it up, on off, Pant goes for the reverse but the ball is too full for the shot. Pant fails to connect and the keeper, Jamie Smith fails to gather it cleanly. The ball clips his fingertips and rolls behind for four byes.
4 Byes.
Very full, wide on off, Pant squeezes it out wide of point for a single.
Very full, wide on off, Pant squeezes it out wide of point for a single.
Flat and short, on off, Rahul punches it to the left of Chris Woakes at mid off, who cuts it off with a dive. They cross.

HUNDRED FOR RISHABH RAJENDRA PANT, TAKE A BOW! His 4th Test century in England and his 8th overall in Test cricket. And this has been some wonderfully carved ton from the left-hander. Sunil Gavaskar, from the stands, gestures towards him to perform the somersault, but Pant keeps it for later. This is pitched outside off, on a length, turning away off the pitch. Rishabh Pant reaches after it and cuts it along the ground in the backward point region for a single. Gets to the other end, has his arms and bat aloft in the air. Gets a huge round of applause from the Headingley crowd and his partner, KL Rahul walks up to him and gives him a warm hug. Twin centuries for Pant in this Test and he becomes the first Indian batter to score hundreds in both innings of a Test in England. Lived a bit dangerously at first, but once settled, he hasn't looked back at all. But this century of his has come at a very crucial juncture under challenging conditions.
1 run.
Spins away again, full and outside off, Rishabh Pant again leaves and the ball stays low to beat the keeper again as it rolls behind. First slip gets to it.
No run.
Outside off, spins away, left alone.

Very full, quicker too, outside off, it lands on the footmark and just dies on the bounce. Pant leaves and the ball ricochets the keeper's pad and rolls behind to short fine leg. The batters do not run.
On 99 now, is Pant! A full toss thrown on the stumps, Rishabh Pant drills it wide of mid on for a single.
1 run.
Very close leave! This one keeps going straight on with the angle, around off, on a fuller length. Left alone by Pant again.
No run.
Full, outside off, left alone.
No run.

Slower, and just outside off, on a length. Rishabh Pant stands tall and carves it away to the right of cover where the fielder dives to his right and stops the ball. Pant sniffs a single, but decides not to run and sends his partner back.
No run.
Flatter and quicker, outside off, Pant does not fall for the bait and lets it be.
No run.
On the shorter side, drifting across middle from around the stumps. KL Rahul punches off the back foot and gets an easy single at deep cover.
1 run.
Slower and fuller, on the off stump. Rishabh Pant lunges forward to defend it to off side.
No run.
Flat and very quick, outside off, Rishabh Pant offers no shot and brings the pad in front to leave.
Fuller and around the off stump. Rishabh Pant works it to extra cover.
No run.
No run.
Wide of off, spinning away, Rishabh Pant reaches after it and then opts out of the shot.
Tossed up, outside off. KL Rahul drives it to mid off. Single taken.
1 run.

Dragged length, outside of, KL Rahul rocks back and cuts it all along the turf towards deep point. Runs the first one easily, and the call is for two, but has to hurry as Chris Woakes is quick to get to the ball in the deep, running to his left from deep cover, and throws it flat to the keeper. KL has to put the skates on and gets home safely by dragging his bat to complete the second.
2 runs.
Slower and shorter, outside off. Rishabh Pant cuts it to backward point.
No run.
Length, on off, stays low a tad bit. KL Rahul punches it to the point region for a single.
1 run.
Fuller and outside off. Rishabh Pant leans forward and taps it to cover for a single.
1 run.
Floated fuller and on middle, swept to deep square leg for a single.
Fuller and on the leg stump line. KL Rahul blocks it to the mid-wicket region.
No run.
Around the stumps, short and outside off. Rishabh Pant stands tall and cuts it behind square to deep backward point for a single.
1 run.
Fuller and around the middle and leg. KL Rahul defends it to the leg side.
No run.

Moves to 96, does Rishabh Pant! Drifts it on middle and leg, from around the stumps, on a length. Rishabh Pant tilts forward, waits for the ball to come and taps it across to the mid-wicket region for a single.
1 run.
Shortish and wide outside off. Rishabh Pant rocks back and cuts it straight to the backward point fielder.
Fuller and on off, pushed back to the bowler.
No run.
Tossed up and fuller, outside off. Rishabh Pant gets his front foot forward and lets it go.
No run.
Drops it on a length, outside off, Pant strides across but decides to leave.
Bangs it on the short of a length, outside off. KL Rahul gets on top of the bounce and works it straight to the square leg fielder.
No run.
A well-directed bumper now, jagging back into the batter from middle. KL Rahul nudges this to the short fine leg region.
Bowls it on a short of a length, just outside off. KL Rahul lets it go to the keeper.
Bumper outside off, KL Rahul shapes to uppercut it, but arches back to leave.
On a back of a length, just around that fifth stump line. KL Rahul rides the bounce and blocks it to mid off.

FOUR! Just guided away! A misdirected short delivery, going on the leg stump line, climbing at the head height of the batter. KL Rahul controls the pull shot and hits it along the ground to the long leg region for a boundary.
A bit short and outside off. Rishabh Pant hops back and cuts it straight to the backward point fielder.

FOUR! That's been punished and how! Short and slow, outside off, spinning away. Rishabh Pant hangs on the back foot, gets enough width and height to cut it away. Bisects that narrow gap between cover and extra cover for a boundary. The 250 is up for India!
Fuller and tossed up, on the off stump. Rishabh Pant looks to go down the ground but doesn't get the right connection and squeezes it back to the bowler.
Very slow through the air, full and on middle. Rishabh Pant waits, waits, and waits for it to arrive before tapping it on the surface.
Comes from over the wicket and bowls it shorter, outside off. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and punches it to the backward point region for one.
Just short of full, outside off, Rishabh Pant reaches out to cut it away, but gets it off the glove as the ball bounces a bit extra. It then rolls wide of the first slip, to short third for a single.
Bowls it on a shorter length, just around the middle and leg. Rishabh Pant pulls it to deep square leg for a single. He is into 90s with the single.

Dug in short, over off, KL swivels and gets on top of the bounce to play the controlled pull towards deep square leg. Harry Brook mops it up in the deep to his left. With this single, the 150-run stand comes up between Pant and Rahul.
Fuller and down the leg side. Rishabh Pant tucks it to mid-wicket for one.
Nagging length, on the leg stump line. Rishabh Pant misses out on the pull shot.

FOUR! Easy pickings for Rishabh Pant! Brydon Carse serves it on a shorter length, outside the leg stump, and it sits up nicely for Rishabh Pant to help that one towards the fine leg region for a boundary. He moves to 88 with that four.

Good fielding in the deep! Short and on the bodyline. Rishabh Pant stands tall and pulls this between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. Ollie Pope runs to his left from deep mid-wicket and gets to the ball with the slide, but fumbles and the ball is lobbed towards the converging fielder from deep square leg, Harry Brook. Brook picks the ball up and throws it back to the keeper. Two taken.

HUNDRED FOR KL RAHUL! A knock of the highest order from a quality player! Could not make the start count in the first innings, but he is standing tall at a vital time for India. Pushed across the right-hander from around the wicket by Bashir, Rahul gets a good stride in and drives this full ball all along the ground to the left of cover and to the right of the man at deep point. Comes back for the second run and completes his 9th Test hundred. Takes the helmet off and soaks in all the applause from his teammates and the Headingley crowd.
Shorter and slower, on middle, Rahul waits back to block.
Fuller and outside off. Rishabh Pant goes hard at it and drives it to the long off fielder for one.

FOUR! Streaky but they all count! Loopy delivery from around the wicket, full and on off, Rishabh Pant waits on it and winds up to go over cover. Swings hard and gets a thickish outside edge that flies past first slip and well wide of Ollie Pope at short third. Pope gives it a chase but in vain.
Fuller, on the leg stump. KL Rahul clips it to deep square leg for a single. He moves to 98 with that single.
Short and turning away, outside off, Pant cloths his shot as he looks to cut it away. Gets it to the right of cover for a single.
Lands it shorter, outside off. KL Rahul rides the bounce and taps it to backward point and wants a single, but is sent back by Pant.

FOUR! Surgical precision! Carse lands it on a back of a length, just outside off, KL Rahul hangs on the back foot and watches it all the way through. Plays the late dab down onto the ground and it goes through the gap between gully and backward point for a boundary. Rahul moves to 97!
Good length, on the off stump. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and blocks it solidly.
Angled in at the hips by Carse, KL turns it off the back foot to mid-wicket.
Lands it on a short of a length, in the corridor of the off stump line. KL Rahul defends it to cover.
This nips back in a bit, on a back of a length, around off, Rahul lifts his bat and makes the leave.
Fuller and angling away from the batter. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and tucks it to cover point for a single.

Wow! It would have been a spectacular grab had Ben Stokes managed to pull it off. Fired in, very full, quicker, outside off, Pant reaches out and slams it flat to the left of cover. Stokes flings himself to his left and gets a hand to it. Manages to take the sting out of the shot and the ball rolls behind for just a single. A very difficult chance as it was smashed at the rate of knots by Pant.
Tossed up and fuller, on the off stump. Rishabh Pant leans forward and blocks it to extra cover.

Looped up, full and on off, Pant stays low to get under the ball and thumps it flat to the right of long off. Chris Woakes at long off is quick to get across to his right and gets his body behind the ball to make the stop. Two runs taken.
Shortish and around the middle and leg. KL Rahul rocks back and taps it to the left of the bowler. Single taken.

FOUR! Put away with ease! Bashir serves a half-tracker, around middle and leg, KL Rahul is quick to go deep in the crease and pulls it towards the deep square leg fence for a boundary. Rahul moves into the 90s!
Bowls it on a good length, just outside off. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and steers it to the right of the gully fielder for a single.
Outside off, on a good length, KL is happy to let that one go.
On a back of a length, angling into the right-hander. KL Rahul works it to short mid-wicket.
On a good length, outside off, Rahul leaves the ball alone.
Lands it a bit shorter, just around middle and off. Rishabh Pant stays leg side and makes a bit of room for himself to tap it to backward point. Single taken.
FOUR! Rishabh Pant welcomes Brydon Carse back into the attack with a thumping shot! On a back of a length, around off, this sits up to be hit and Pant hammers it through mid-wicket for a boundary.
Looped up, Bashir spots Pant stepping out and bowls it wider, on off, Pant steps out and reaches out to drill it to long off for a single.
Sliding on with the arm from around the wicket, full and on middle, Pant brings his bat out in front to block.

SIX! Another one from Rishabh Pant! Shoaib Bashir tossed it up fuller and just outside the off stump. Rishabh Pant once again gets under it and goes over long on for a biggie. Second six of the over and with this six, India cross 200. The lead is now 211.
Flatter and shorter, on middle, Pant stays back to block.

SIX! Biggie from the middle of the bat! Shoaib Bashir serves it on a fuller and just around the off stump. Rishabh Pant gets down on one knee and hammers that one over long on for a six! India's lead is now 205 runs!
Short and on off, Rahul goes back and pushes it wide of cover for a single.
On a back of a length, outside off. Rishabh Pant guides it to backward point.
On a back of a length, around off, Pant lets it go.

FOUR! Short and punished! Josh Tongue errs in both line and length. Short and wide on off, asking to be hit. Pant obliges as he frees his arms and thrashes it through point for a boundary. India's lead is now 198!

FIFTY up for Rishabh Pant and it's his 16th half century in Test cricket! Josh Tongue bowls it on a back of length,  around outside off. Rishabh Pant clips it behind square leg for a couple of runs to bring up his half century. Called a NO BALL as Tongue has overstepped.

FOUR! Edged away! In the corridor on off, on a back of a length, Pant has a slight fiddle at the delivery whilst staying on the back foot. Gets an outside edge that goes through the vacant third slip region for a boundary.
Bowls it on a good length, nips back sharply onto the pads. It keeps a bit low just around the knee roll area, and KL Rahul tucks it to deep backward square leg for a single.

Angling in, on a nagging length, with an upright seam, on off, KL Rahul looks to get on the front foot to deal with it. This shoots off the deck but Rahul does well to adjust by taking the bottom hand off the handle and fends it down towards gully.
Shorter and outside off. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and works it to backward point for one.
Short and on middle, Rahul works it off the hips to square leg.
Slower through the air, a bit short and just around middle and off. KL Rahul taps it to short mid-wicket.
Flatter and fuller, on middle, KL stays back to nudge it beside the pitch on the leg side.
Shortish and on the stumps. KL Rahul rocks back and tucks it to short mid-wicket.
From around the wicket, floated up, on middle, KL Rahul defends it right under his eyes.
Fuller and on off, eased to mid off by Pant.

Beaten! Tongue hits the deck hard and this kicks up a bit, outside off, Rishabh Pant makes a late decision to go after it and tries to cut it behind square on the off side with an angled bat. Gets beaten as the ball rears up to go over the bat.
Bowled from wide of the crease on the around-the-wicket angle, on a nagging length, on middle, Rishabh tucks it to mid-wicket from the crease.
Josh digs it in short, at pace, over off, Rishabh Pant ducks under it.
On a good length, outside off, left alone by RP.

FOUR! Deft touch! On a back of a length, in the channel on off, Rishabh Pant gets on his toes and ensures that he plays it late and dabs it down onto the ground. Gets it fine enough of the man at deep third for a boundary.
Tosses it up, full and on off, Rahul works it to the left of Ben Stokes at a straightish mid-wicket but the English skipper is quick to cut it off and deny the single.
With a flatter trajectory, on off, on a nagging length, Rahul stabs it beside the pitch on the off side.
More loop on this one, on a length, on off, Rahul covers the line and pushes it back to Bashir.
On the shorter side, on off, Rahul tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Slows it down and pulls the length back, on off, Rahul gets forward to defend.

FOUR! Nicely done! Shoaib Bashir pushes it through, around off, on a length. KL Rahul is quick to get into the position. Plants his front foot across and gets low to control the sweep. Gets his hands through and sweeps it all along the ground through backward square leg.
Angled in at the hips, Rahul helps it down to deep fine leg and picks up a single. India's lead is now 177!
Slanting down leg, on a short of a length, Rahul stays inside the line of the ball and offers no shot.
Tongue nails the yorker, right at the base of the middle stump, KL Rahul hurriedly gets his bat down to keep it out.

Swing and a miss! This is on a back of a length from around the wicket, over middle, Rishabh Pant clears his front leg and has a wild hoick across the line. The ball sneaks under the bat and goes on the bounce to the keeper. Jamie Smith gets his body behind the ball but fails to gather it cleanly. The ball deflects off his gloves to his right, allowing the batters to sneak in a bye.
On a hard length, on middle and leg, KL hops and nudges it to deep backward square leg for a run.
Sprayed down leg, Rahul misses out on the tickle to this full ball. The keeper, Jamie Smith, dives away to his left and there is half a shout for caught behind but nothing doing, says the umpire.
Shorter and quicker, on off, Rishabh pats it to the left of the man at backward point. Rahul wants a single but Pant sends him back.
Full and on off, eased down to long on for one more.
Looped up, outside off, very full, Rahul thought about sweeping it but judging the fullness of the delivery, he changed his mind and played it back to the bowler.
Floated up, on off, pushed back to Bashir.
A bit too full, on off, driven down to long off for a single by RP.
Aimed at the rough outside the left-hander's off stump and it lands on the footmark. A puff of dust as the ball lands. Spins away a bit but Rishabh offers no shot.
On a hard length, outside off, Rishabh Pant hangs back and flays at it. It goes uppishly but well wide of backward point to his right. Mopped up in the deep by the man at deep third. Single taken.
Brings the line closer to the off stump and this is on a length, Pant watchfully makes a leave.
Banged into the wicket but not close enough to make the batter play. Well wide on off and an easy leave for Rishabh.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Rishabh Pant lets the ball go past him.

FOUR! Nothing streaky about this one! A bit of width offered by Josh, on a length, Pant puts the dancing shoes on and reaches out a bit to drill it to the left of deep point for four more. India's lead goes up to 171.

FOUR! No slip and it races away! Josh serves a full ball, on off, Pant is a bit tentative with his footwork as he goes for the drive. It's almost as if Rishabh made a late decision to go for the drive. Gets an outside edge that goes to the left of the keeper and right where the first slip would have been.
Nice loop on this from Bashir, bowled from a bit wide on the crease. Around off, the ball drops on KL Rahul as he gets forward to defend.
Drags the length back, outside off, KL goes deep in the crease and pushes it to cover.
Slows it down, on off, Rahul blocks it out off the front foot.
FOUR! Fine shot! A bit too full from Bashir and the length does not allow the ball to turn, outside off, Rahul leans into the drive and hits it to the left of the diving cover fielder for a boundary.
Pushed through, on off, on a length, Rahul reaches out in front and plays for the turn as he looks to knock it towards mid on. Gets a soft leading back towards the bowler.
This keeps straight, short and outside off, KL presses back and dabs it to backward point.
Josh Tongue starts with a maiden! Aimed at the sticks, on the fuller side, at 138 kph, Rishabh Pant clips it straight to mid-wicket.
A bit too wide, on a short of a length, Rishabh lets it be.

Nearly dragged it back onto the stumps! Pitched up by Josh from around the wicket, outside off, Pant is a bit tentative on the drive. Does not move his feet much and just goes at it with his hands. Gets an inside edge onto the pads.
Hurls it on a good length, in the corridor on off, left alone by Rishabh.
Goes fuller on this occasion, around off, Pant leans into it and pushes it to cover.
Tongue beats the bat straight away! This skids through, short and wide on off, Pant is late on the cut and reaches out to make connection but misses.
Slanting into the pads, on a nagging length, Rishabh Pant turns it past short leg and takes a single. India lead by 159 runs and that will be LUNCH on Day 4!
Floated up, full and around off, Rahul works it with the turn to the right of mid on and crosses over.
Tosses it up, on middle and leg, Pant steps out and ends up getting too close to the ball but manages to jam it out to the left of mid on for a single.
Ollie Pope comes in at short leg! A bit quicker and fractionally short, on off, Pant stays back and dabs it down late to the left of first slip for a couple of runs.
Slows it down and offers flight, fuller and at the stumps, Rishabh gets on the front foot to smother the spin.
Pushed through, flat and short, on middle, Pant goes on the back foot and ekes out an inside edge onto the pads.
Lands it on a back of a length, just outside off, KL lets the ball go past him.
Stokes bends his back and digs it in short, over middle, Rahul swivels for the pull but the ball comes on slower than he expected it to. Gets an inside edge right onto the box.
Bowled from slightly wide of the crease, on a good length, on off, Rahul is solid as a rock as he blocks it out off the front foot.
In the channel on off, a bit full, Rahul tucks his bat inside the line and makes the leave.
On a short of a length, on off, Rahul gets on his toes to stab it down the deck.
Attacking the off stump, on a length, KL brings his bat out in front and taps it back to Ben.
Sliding onto the pads, on a length, Pant reaches out in front for the flick. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball drops off the pads beside the pitch on the leg side.
Floated up, outside off, driven all along the ground to deep point for a single by KL.
Keeps it short, on off, Rahul presses back and plays it back to Bashir.
Leg bye! Flat and short, around leg, Pant misses out on the tickle. A leg bye is taken as the ball rolls in front of short fine leg.
Loopy delivery, on off, kept out off the front foot by Pant.
Darted in from around the wicket, on a length, around leg, Pant plays for the turn and gets beaten on the inside edge on the defence.
Very full, at the toes, Rishabh gets low and squeezes it out in front of deep square leg for one more.
Dug in short but the line is down leg, Pant ducks under it.
On off, on a nagging length, Rishabh Pant gets right behind it.
On the pads, on a good length, KL works it behind square on the leg side and crosses over.

Oh, there's that odd ball every now and then that kicks up! On a back of a length, over off, Rahul stays back to deal with it with a straight bat. Gets taken aback by the extra bounce and gets beaten on the outside edge. The ball catches him on the right arm before dribbling towards the slip cordon.

FOUR! Lovely! Angled in by Stokes from over the wicket, on a length, on off, Rahul presses on the front quickly and eases the drive through covers for a boundary. The 50-run stand comes up between these two. India's lead is now 150.
Beaten! Closer to the off stump, on a good length from around the wicket, Pant tenatively defends away from his body and is lucky not to nick this one behind.
Wide on off, on a back of a length, Rishabh offers no shot.
In the channel on off, on a length, left alone by RP.
On off, on a good length, Pant covers the line and plays it back to Josh.
On a back of a length, on off, KL steers it towards gully, where Ben Duckett dives to his right to make a half-stop but does not manage to prevent the single.
Full and on middle, flicked to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Full length and outside off. Slower one and KL Rahul let it go.
Moving away in the air, fuller in length, outside off, KL leaves the ball alone.

Extra bounce on that one! Ben Stokes goes shorter and outside off. Climbing onto the batter and KL Rahul rides the bounce and takes the bottom hand off the bat, which ensures that it doesn't carry to Ben Duckett at gully.
Drags the length back, around off, Rahul tucks his bat inside the line and lets the ball go past him.
Fuller and outside off. KL Rahul drives it to mid off.
Uh oh, Ben Stokes has overstepped once again! Ben Stokes bowls it on a shorter length and outside off. KL Rahul cuts it to the point region. Umpire signals NO BALL.
Short and wide on off, Rishabh frees his arms and eases it to deep point for a single.
Bowls it on a good length, just outside the off stump. KL Rahul hides his bat behind his front foot and leaves it to the keeper.
On the fuller side, around the sixth stump, KL Rahul plants his front foot forward and shoulders arms.
Back of a length, outside off. KL Rahul shoulders arms at it.
A rare loose shot from KL but he gets away with it! Short and wide on off, Rahul goes for the cut half-heartedly and it is almost an afterthought. The ball kicks up a bit to go over the bat.

Bowls it on the back of a length, angling onto the middle and off. KL Rahul tucks it to the left of deep backward square leg, where Ben Duckett moves to his left and dives to intercept the ball. He, though, makes a half stop as he slides on with the momentum but manages to recover well. Retrieves the ball from his left, as it slows up just before the ropes, and keeps it to two.
Serves it on a length, on off, Rahul lunges to block it out.
Bowls it on the hard length, on the off stump. Rishabh Pant taps it mid-wicket and wants a single on that, but is sent back by KL. Stokes has a chirp at Pant, but it’s all in good spirits.

FOUR! Off the edge! On a good length, on off, Rishabh Pant does not jab at the ball with hard hands and plays it with soft hands. More of an educated edge and it goes through the vacant gully region for a boundary.
Goes fuller and slower but slanting down the leg side. Rishabh Pant looks to flick that one but misses it to the keeper.
Stokes goes full, on off, Rishabh gets low and keeps it out with a straight bat.
Bowls it on a good length, angling into the right-hander. KL Rahul tucks it to deep backward square leg. Single taken.
Angling in and then seaming away off the deck, outside off, KL Rahul shoulders arms.
Pitches it on the back of a length, angling onto the pads. KL Rahul clips it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Serves it fuller, attacking the stumps, knocked to mid on by KL.
Hits the hard length, on the off stump channel. KL Rahul rides the bounce and defends it back to the bowler.

On middle and leg, on a short of a length, Pant gets on the back foot and tucks it in front of deep square leg. The call is for two initially but Zak Crawley gets to the ball quickly and keeps it to one.
On a back of a length, just outside the off stump. Rishabh Pant gets on top of the bounce and blocks it back to the bowler.
On a hard length, on off, Pant hops back and gets closer to the line. Drops it beside the pitch on the off side and takes off for a single before being sent back by Rahul.
That takes off from the pitch! Ben Stokes bowls it on a hard length and just outside off. The ball pitches and just gets some extra bounce off the deck. KL Rahul lets it go to the keeper.
In the channel on off, on the fuller side, KL leaves the ball alone.
No run.
Again very full by Stokes, on off, Rahul jams it out to short cover.
Comes from around the wicket and bowls it fuller, outside off. Rishabh Pant steers it to deep backward point for a single.
Slanting in at the pads, on a length, Rahul whips it to the right of mid on for a single.
On a good length, on the off stump line. Angling into the left-hander, Rishabh Pant taps it to the right of the bowler.
Wide! Josh Tongue bangs in short of a length, and it sails over Rishabh Pant's head. WIDED!

DROPPED! Harry Brook puts down a sharp chance! On a hard length, around off, KL Rahul hangs back and is in two minds whether to play the late dab or leave it. Ends up playing a nothing shot as he guides it straight to gully whilst attempting to withdraw his bat. It goes at head height to Brook there at gully and he does get both hands over his head. The ball hits him hard on the palm and pops out before lobbing behind him and a single is taken.

FOUR! Just a feather touch from KL Rahul! Josh Tongue bowls it on the back of a length and outside off. KL Rahul rocks on the back foot and plays it late to guide it ​​​​​​between the slip cordon and gully for a four.
Short and well wide on off, Rahul lets it go.
On a back of a length, angling into the left-hander. Rishabh Pant rides the bounce and taps it to mid-wicket for a single.

Big swing and a miss! Tongue steams in from around the wicket and angles it in, on a length, around leg, Rishabh Pant skips down the track to go back over the bowler's head but fails to connect. The ball sneaks just past the leg stump.
On a good length, angling into the right-hander. KL Rahul tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Same length, same line, Rahul does the same. Leaves it.
Fairly outside off, short of a good length, KL Rahul opts to leave as it keeps shaping away.
Length, moving away, outside off, left alone.
Uh, oh! A No Ball for overstepping! A gentle outswinger from outside off. KL Rahul almost goes fishing at it, but aborts to bring his bat down and makes a watchful leave.
Comes from over the wicket and bowls it on a good length, outside off. KL Rahul shoulders arms at it.

Inswinger from around the wickets, on a hard length, angling toward the leg stump. Rishabh Pant attempts to steer it into the leg side, but misses. The ball grazes the front thigh pad and rolls to deep fine leg. They get a leg bye.
On a back of a length, outside off. KL Rahul once again gets his bat inside the line and lets it go to the keeper.
Nagging length, skidding through and going straight on, just outside off. KL Rahul with his signature leave as he drags the bat inside the line to let that pass.
On a back of a length, angling into the left-hander. Rishabh Pant gets on the back foot and tucks it to mid-wicket. Single taken.
Short delivery, on middle and leg. KL Rahul nudges this behind square to the leg side with soft hands, and jogs for a single.
Bowls it on a good length, on the off stump line. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and blocks it to the point region.
Tails into the batter, from middle. KL Rahul brings his bat in front and taps it into the leg side.
On the fuller length, just around outside off stump. Rishabh Pant prods forward and defends it to the offf side.

BEAUTY! Carse has made the ball talk so far in this spell! Outside off, that fourth or fifth stump line, on a fuller length. Rishabh Pant draws his front foot out to defend, but plays inside the line and the ball beats the bat to go behind.
Goes fuller, angling on to the pads. KL Rahul clips it to deep backward square leg for one.
Just outside off, on a length, Rishabh Pant guides the ball through backward point for a single.
Hits the hard length, angling into the left-hander. Rishabh Pant gets behind the line and blocks it back to the bowler.
Skids through, on the back of a length, on off. Rishabh Pant opens up and stabs it on the pitch.
A bit fuller length, just outside off. KL Rahul lets it go to the keeper.
Full and on the fourth stump, KL Rahul presses forward and hides his bat behind the front pad to let the ball go through.
Lands it on the hard length, angling back on to the stumps. KL Rahul gets behind the line and blocks it back to the bowler.
Angling on the leg stump, full in length, clipped to the mid-wicket region.
Bowls it on a good length, on that fifth stump line. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and shoulders arms at it.
Nice and full, outside off, KL Rahul blocks it straight.

What was Pant trying to do here? Quite an audacious attempt to scoop a fast bowler who is going more than 130 clicks. An appeal for LBW, but the umpire shakes his head. Brydon Carse looks certain that he has got his man, but the skipper Ben Stokes is a bit reluctant and gestures that he heard two noises, but eventually opts for a review. Coming to the delivery, Carse bowls this full and angling into the line of the stumps, from around the wickets. Rishabh Pant premeditates the shot, gets across and attempts to scoop it over short fine leg, but does not quite get the connection, and loses his balance completely before falling over on the pitch. Now, the question is whether the ball brushed off his bat. And yes, the UltraEdge does show a spike when the ball is next to the inside edge. It then thuds on the pad. Not Out and Pant stays, living a bit dangerously out there.
Full and just outside off, Pant skips down the track and slaps that hard, but straight to the cover fielder.
Bangs it on the short of a length, on the middle and off. Rishabh Pant gets on top of the bounce and blocks it back to the bowler.

TOP EDGE, FOUR! Pant trying to be a bit too funky but gets away with that! Speared fuller and from around the stumps. Rishabh Pant tries to slog this over the leg side, but gets a thick top edge and the wind helps the ball to sail to the deep and lands on the bounce, between the converging deep backward square leg fielder and Joe Root from the slips, and dribbles into the ropes at deep fine leg.
On a nagging length, angling onto the off stump. Rishabh Pant rides the bounce and defends it to the off side.
Back of a length, angling on the pads, KL Rahul steers this away to deep square leg for a single.
Slower one from Chris Woakes, on a fuller length, outside off. Rishabh Pant leaves it alone to the keeper.

FOUR! Audacious! Hard length from Woakes, just outside off, Rishabh Pant dances down the track and plays it with a flat bat angle. Not quite from the middle of the bat, but he hits it hard enough and the ball goes straight down the ground for a boundary. Woakes tries to stop that by bending low to the left on the follow-through but stands no chance of stopping that. INDIA LEAD BY 113 RUNS!
On a good length, outside off. Rishabh Pant shoulders arms at it and lets it go.
A gentle inswinger, full and outside off, driven straight to the cover fielder.
Lands it on the good length, coming back sharply into the left-hander. Rishabh Pant is stuck in the crease as he looks to work it on the off side and gets an inside edge onto his pad.
Full and straight, just outside off, Pant presses ahead and stabs it into the off side.
Bowls it on the good length, outside off. KL Rahul tucks his bat behind his front foot and leaves it to the keeper.
Solid in defence, is Rahul. Back of a length, on top of off. KL Rahul punches it off the back foot.
Pitches it on the back of a length, targeting the off stump. KL Rahul hops back and defends it to the point region.
Good length and shaping in from outside off, Rahul looks to defend from the crease and gets an inside edge onto his pad.
On the back of a length, outside off stump line. KL Rahul gets on top of the bounce and guides it to the gully fielder.

Full and outside off, KL Rahul drives it straight to the cover fielder, where Zak Crawley makes a good stop, low to his left. Cheers echo as the crowd thinks that it went straight into the hands of Crawley, but the replay shows that it bumped onto the pitch, right off the bat, before travelling to the fielder.
Outside off, on a hard length. KL Rahul gets on the back foot, plays it late and glides it to the right of the diving gully fielder for a single.
On top of middle and off, KL Rahul hops on the back foot and taps it to the off side.

BEATEN! Two corkers of deliveries from Woakes and the crowd is right behind the bowler! Brings the angle closer to the off stump, on a yard behind fuller length. It just lands and straightens off the pitch and moves away from the batter. KL Rahul leans forward to defend, but the ball flirts past the outside edge again.

Bowls from a wider angle, does Woakes, and pitches it full and on the fourth stump line, angling in. KL Rahul presses forward to defend, but plays inside the line and the ball passes near the outside edge by a whisker.
Just in that corridor of uncertainty, on a good length. KL Rahul watches it closely and leaves as the ball nibbles away.
Good length, outside off, Pant punches this between mid off and cover for a quick single.
Nagging length, going straight on, just on top of off. KL Rahul brings the bat inside the line to make the leave.
Nice and full, on off, pushed to mid off.

FIFTY FOR KL RAHUL! A calm, composed innings from him. Raises his bat as he gets to his 18th Test half century! Full and with an inward shape on middle and leg, KL Rahul works that to deep mid-wicket, off the inside half of the bat, for a couple of runs as the ball rolls in the wide space in the deep. The tourists are leading by 107 runs now.

Absolute peach! The skipper loves it and so does the crowd at Headingley! Back of a length, just holding its line, around off. KL Rahul plays inside the line of the ball and gets beaten on the outside edge.
Well bowled! Switches to over the stumps for the right-hander. The nip-backer from outside off, on a hard length. KL Rahul tries to block it straight, gets an inside edge on the inner thigh pad.
An inswinger from around the stumps, full in length. Rishabh Pant prods forward and works it off the inside half of the bat, to the deep mid-wicket region for a single.
A full toss that moves away from the batter. Rishabh Pant casually eases it to the backward point region for a single.
Identical line and length, and Pant again shoulders arms at it.
Outside off, good length, with extra bounce. Pant leaves this harmless delivery.
Comes in with the angle on a length, around off. Rishabh Pant is caught in the crease, and tries to punch off the back foot, but gets an inside edge, onto the flap of the pad.
Slows it up, does Woakes, but sprays it down the leg side, on a length. Rishabh Pant gets inside the line to nudge it away, but misses to lay the bat on it.
On middle, back of a length, Rishabh Pant gets right behind the line, opens up a bit, and knocks it back to the bowler.
This one curves back, a tempter just outside off, on a length. KL Rahul does not fall for the bait and offers no shot.
A bit of shape away from the batter, but well outside off. KL Rahul is not interested to poke at that.
Full and aimed at the pegs, angling in. KL Rahul pushes this to mid on.
Another one that takes off the deck, outside off, on a good length. KL Rahul again shoulders his arms.
Back of a length, speared on the middle stump line, nipping in further. KL Rahul looks to work that across into the leg side, but plays over it and the ball rams into his front thigh pad.
Short of a good length, with some extra lift off the deck, outside off. KL Rahul lifts his bat in the air and sees the ball carry to the keeper.
Good length, just outside off, Rishabh Pant plays it late and dabs it to the right of point. Looks for a single, but is sent back by KL Rahul on an early call.
Nagging length, around off, blocked off the back foot by Pant.

EDGED AND FOUR! A wry smile from Woakes as Pant gets adventurous from the get go! Pitched fuller and outside off, Rishabh Pant skips down the track and swings hard at it, looking to go downtown, but only manages to get a thick leading edge that flies over the slip cordon for a boundary at deep third.
On a length, outside off, from around the stumps. Pant leaves.
Hard length, outside off, KL Rahul lets the ball arrive and punches that through covers with a straight bat. The ball rolls to the deep cover region and they cross.
Back of a length, around off, KL Rahul brings his bat in front and drops it into the off side.

OUT! DRAGGED ON! BOWLED! Just 7 deliveries into Day 4 and Brydon Carse has produced an early breakthrough for England, setting the tone for the hosts. Carse steams in from over the stumps, pitches it a yard behind the fuller length, just outside off. It lands and cuts back into the batter as Shubman Gill tries to cut it square on the off side, but the ball is not that wide and hence, he doesn't get much space to work that through. A thick inside edge is found and the ball bumps straight into the stumps. Shubman Gill, who scored a marathon 147 in the first innings, departs for just 8 this time around. India are 92/3, leading by 98 runs!
Shubman Gill (c) b B Carse 8 (16b 1x4 0x6)
On the fuller side again, on a similar line, Shubman Gill again blocks it out.
Straight and full, at off, Gill prods forward and defends it right under his eyes.

First runs of Day 4! Short and around the leg stump line, Shubman Gill jabs it away to the right of deep square leg. Chris Woakes tumbles to his right and tries to lob it towards the converging Shoaib Bashir to his right but ends up lobbing it well past him. It allows Gill to take the second run. INDIA LEAD BY 98 RUNS!
A slight tail into the batter, on a fullish length, Shubman Gill presses forward and presents a solid front foot block.
On the back of a length, climbing on the batter, around off, Gill brings his bat in front and blocks it off the back foot to the off side.
Bashir pushes it through, fuller and spinning in from middle, KL Rahul leans on and taps it to the mid-wicket region.
Flatter and fuller, on off, KL Rahul presses forward and taps it to backward point.
Dropped fuller and outside off, driven towards deep cover for a single.
BEATEN! Floats it up, fuller and just outside off. It lands and just goes straight on to beat the bat of Shubman Gill who leans forward to block it out.
Drags the length back, outside off, KL Rahul rocks and punches it through the point region for a single.
Tossed up, full and outside off, Shubman Gill strides out and pushes it to the left of cover for a single.

Slants it onto the pads, does Stokes, on a shortish length. Shubman Gill does not connect and the ball rolls off the thigh pad, and goes through the backward square leg region for a leg bye. Bashir comes charging forward from the deep to pick the ball.
Attacks the stumps this time around, tailing in from off, Shubman Gill flicks it solidly to mid on.
Full, shaping away, outside off, Gill leaves this harmless delivery.
JAFFA! This one cuts away off the deck, on a good length, outside off. Shubman Gill with a casual poke away from his body, and the ball flirts past the outside edge.
Same length, same line, Gill again misses to lay bat on it and Jamie Smith again dives to his left to grab it.

This one goes across the batter, on the leg side, on a good length. Shubman Gill looks to glance it across, but misses and Jamie Smith the keeper dives low to his left to grab the ball. There's a slight appeal for caught behind but it wanes away sooner.
Drops it shorter in length, and outside off, KL Rahul hangs back and taps it with soft hands to the point region.
Floated up, full and just outside off with a bit of a spin into the batter. KL Rahul leans to defend but the ball takes the inside edge and rolls to mid-wicket.
Full and flat, outside off, KL Rahul covers the stumps and offers no shot.
Very slow again, just outside off, KL Rahul gets back and across and knocks it straight back at the bowler.
This one takes months to reach the batter. Slower through the air, outside off, on a length. KL leaves.
Bashir is back on. Bowls it on a length, around off, and spins in. Rahul hangs back to tap it back to the bowler.

FOUR! The Indian skipper is up and running in style! Short and wide of off, Shubman Gill hops on the toes and guides the ball over the gully region for a boundary. Stokes kicks the ground in frustration. INDIA LEAD BY 92 RUNS!

OUT! GONE! CAUGHT! Call it a commentator's curse or something else, but Sai Sudharsan has to depart here. Again, Ben Stokes with the golden arm and breaks the 66-run partnership. Brings the angle into the batter, does Stokes, landing the ball on a fuller length, Sai Sudharsan weighs on the front foot to flick the ball into the leg side, but does not quite manage to keep it along the ground and ends up hitting it flat and low, to the right of Zak Crawley at mid-wicket. The English opener bends low and snaffles a good low catch. Sai Sudharsan departs on 30 and India are 82/2.
Sai Sudharsan c Z Crawley b B Stokes 30 (48b 4x4 0x6)

FOUR! Into his 30s now, is Sai Sudharsan! Has looked very composed so far! Stokes aims the front pad of the batter, and bowls it on a fuller length, Sai Sudharsan gets on the back foot and clips it to the vacant deep backward square leg for a boundary. The stand grows to 66 runs now.
That in-between length, around the fourth stump, Sai Sudharsan gets on the back foot and cuts it square, to the left ot deep backward point for a couple of runs.
Short, but wide of off, Sudharsan leans back to watch the ball sail behind to the keeper.
Angled into the batter, on the leg stump, on a length, Sai tilts forward and punches this to mid on.
This is bowled outside off, and full, KL Rahul does not poke at it. INDIA LEAD BY 82 RUNS!
Fuller and straighter, that inviting line, but a bit too full, outside off. KL Rahul gets on top of it and drives it to the off side.
Short and on the stumps, KL Rahul stands upright and pulls this towards the right of deep mid-wicket and as the fielder in the deep mops it up, the batters cross twice.
FOUR! Pure cricketing stroke that! A full ball, offered around off, KL Rahul gets a huge stride out on the front foot and caresses the ball through covers for a classic boundary.
Speared in fuller and on middle, KL Rahul with a straight bat face, pushes it gently to mid on.
Wide of off, on a length, KL shoulders arms at it.
On a back of a length, on the stumps. KL Rahul taps it to mid-wicket for a single.
Angled on middle and leg, full in length. KL Rahul meets the ball right under his eyes and blocks it out.
Goes fuller, angling down the leg side. KL Rahul looks to flick but misses it and Jamie Smith dives to his left to collect it.
Overpitched, full and shaping away from outside off. KL Rahul tries to drive to the off side, but gets an underedge and the ball bumps to brush off his body before rolling onto the pitch.
On a good length, outside off. KL Rahul leaves it alone to the keeper.
Fairly outside off, just cutting across the tramline, KL Rahul makes the leave.

DROPPED! Josh Tongue bowls it short and wide, outside off. Sai Sudharsan throws his hands at it and goes for the cut. He is made to reach out and is a bit late on the shot. The ball flies towards backward point off the toe end of the bat. Ben Duckett is the fielder there at backward point, who tries to grab it to his right but the ball pops out after hitting his palm. He has another crack at it while falling over to the right side but fails to cling on.

Bashes the hard length, on top of off, Sai Sudharsan hops off and tucks this past mid-wicket for a couple of runs as the fielder, Brydon Carse, chases the ball to the deep. Sai wants the third as he turns around for it, but is sent back by KL Rahul on a sharp call. Hence, the batters settle with just a couple.

An appeal of LBW, but the umpire stays unmoved. Josh Tongue bowls it on a good length, angling into the left-hander. Sai Sudharsan hops back and looks to defend it on the leg side but gets an inside edge on the front pad.
Short of a length, outside off, Sai offers no shot and leaves it alone.
Pitches it on the short of a length, outside off. Sai Sudharsan looks to cut that one but gets beaten on the top edge.
Around the stumps, straight and full, on off, Sai Sudharsan presses forward and stabs it onto the pitch as the ball rolls behind to the gully region.
On a good length, angling into the left-hander. Sai Sudharsan taps it to mid-wicket for a single.
Speared in fuller and on middle, from around the stumps. Sai Sudharsan watches the ball till the end and eases it out to backward point.
Comes from around the wicket and bowls it on a good length but slanting down the leg side. Sai Sudharsan offers no shot to it and lets it go.

Had to hurry! Back of a length, angling into the batter, on middle and leg, KL Rahul gets across and nudges this to the mid-wicket region and sets off for a quick run. Chris Woakes is quick to move to his right and gets on the ball and releases a quick throw at the bowling end, but misses to score the direct hit. KL Rahul puts in a full-stretched dive to get in. This also brings up the 50-run stand between Sudharsan and KL Rahul.
On a nagging length, just outside off. KL Rahul shoulders arms and lets it go.
Swings away a shy bit, from off, on the good length, KL Rahul makes a watchful leave.
Bends his back and drops it short, outside off. Sai Sudharsan lets it go to the keeper.
Shortish delivery, on middle, KL Rahul climbs on the bounce and drops it with soft hands, beside the pitch on the leg side.
On a back of a length, outside off. KL Rahul shoulders arms at it.
Sprays it down leg, on a good length, KL Rahul shapes to play the pull shot but misses to lay any bat on it.
Lands it on a good length, slanting down the leg side. KL Rahul looks to flick but misses it, and Jamie Smith behind the wicket dives to his left to pouch it.
Nagging length, on top of middle, KL Rahul gets right behind it and dabs it down on the track.

FOUR! Pure timing on that one from Sai Sudharsan! Ben Stokes bowls it on a fuller length and outside off. Angling away from the left-hander and Sai Sudharsan gets on the front foot to guide it to the left of the backward point fielder for a four.
Third ball in a row down leg, Sai Sudharsan opts to leave it alone again.
Another one down leg, on the fuller side, Sudharsan lets it be.
Sprayed down leg, on a length, an easy leave for Sai.
Bowls it on a good length, just around middle and off. The ball takes off a bit after pitching and hits the handle of Sai Sudharsan's bat. Sai manages to fend it down on the off side.
Ben Stokes starts with a loosener. This is short and wide on off, Rahul leans back and cuts it a bit uppishly but away from the man at point to his left. They cross.
Lands it on the back of a length, outside off stump channel. Sai Sudharsan leaves it alone to the keeper.
On off, on a back of a length, Rahul guides it with an open bat face to the right of gully. The initial call is of 'wait' from KL before deciding to cross over.
Wide! Dug in short by Tongue but the line is down leg and this goes over the head of Rahul. Given wide for height.
Pitches it on the short of a length, outside off. KL Rahul plays it late and dabs it straight to the gully fielder.
Slanting in, just outside the off stump, on a nagging length, KL Rahul lets it go past him.
On the back of a length, just around that fifth stump line. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and blocks it to cover.
Outside off, on a good length, left alone by KL.
Tossed up, outside off. Sai Sudharsan gets forward and dabs it to the backward point region.
Slower through the air but the length stays short, KL helps it with the turn to deep backward square leg for a single.
Shortish and outside off. KL Rahul gets on the back foot and tucks it to the right of backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Short, around middle and leg, Rahul rocks back and works it to mid-wicket.
FOUR! Loosener and KL Rahul puts it away! Shoaib Bashir drops it shorter, around middle and leg. KL Rahul rocks back and pulls that one through deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Sprayed on the pads, on a nagging length, Sai tucks it to the left of square leg for a single. 50 comes up for India!
On a good length, wide outside off. KL Rahul lets it go.
Lands it on a back of a length, outside off, left alone by KL.
Lands it on a fuller length, just around that off stump. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and shoulder arms at it.
In the corridor of off, on a good length, Rahul shoulders arms.

FOUR! KL Rahul showing intent! Josh Tongue serves it on a full length and outside the off stump. KL Rahul sees the width offer on that one and leans into it to square drive it through point for a four.
A bit too short, outside off, KL Rahul resists and does not go after it. Opts to leave it alone instead.
Full-length ball, on the off stump. Sai Sudharsan gets on the front foot to defend but gets an outside edge to the backward point fielder.
The length is pulled back, on middle, Sai hops and nudges it to square leg.
Bowls it fuller, on off. Some swing into the left-hander. Sai Sudharsan prods forward and tucks it to mid on.
Serves it fuller, on off, Sai Sudharsan defends it right under his eyes.
On a fuller length, outside off. angling into the left-hander. Sai Sudharsan leans forward and defends it solidly to mid off.
On a back of a length, on middle, Sai walks a couple of steps down the track and pushes it back to Woakes.

FOUR! Elegant cover drive from KL! Brydon Carse bowls it fuller and outside off stump. KL Rahul sees the width outside off stump and gets on the front foot to drive it through the cover region for a four. A good over for India as 12 runs come from it. INDIA LEAD BY 51 RUNS.
This squares Rahul up a bit in defence, angling in and then nipping away, on a good length, KL defends it off the back foot.

FOUR! Class of KL Rahul written on it! Brydon Carse serves it fuller and slanting onto the pads. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and shows the full face of the bat. Drives it along the carpet to the right of the bowler, wide of mid on for a four.
In the channel on off, on a good length, KL Rahul tucks his bat behind the front pad and lets it be.

An all run four! Angling into the pads, on a good length, KL Rahul wrists it through square leg. Josh Tongue from deep backward square leg runs to his left and tumbles to flick the ball away from the fence. Ends up flicking it over the converging Shoaib Bashir. It rolls towards deep mid-wicket and that allows the batters to run four.
On a good length, on off, KL waits back and blocks it out.

Ends the over with a good length, just outside off stump. Sai Sudharsan gets forward to defend it but gets beaten on the outside edge. Ben Stokes looks a bit interested in the review but decides not to take it in the end.
Sliding onto the pads, on a nagging length, Sai makes use of the angle and works it to the right of deep backward square leg. Shoaib Bashir mops it up in the deep. Two runs taken.
Bowls it on a back of a length, angling into the left-hander. Sai Sudharsan clips it to mid on.

FOUR! This is on a short of a length, on off, Sai Sudharsan lets the ball come to him and meets the ball right under his eyes. Gets it more of the outer half of the bat but down on the ground and it goes between third slip and gully for a four.
On a back of a length, outside off. Sai Sudharsan hops back and tucks it to the backward point region.
Beaten! Chris Woakes floats it up from around the wicket, outside off, Sai Sudharsan is better off leaving this alone but he fishes at the delivery. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
Lands it fuller, angling onto the off stump. Sai Sudharsan gets forward and works it to backward point for a quick single.
Slanting in at the hips, on a back of a length, Rahul hangs back and nudges it through square leg for a single.
Fuller, outside off. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and drives it to mid off.
In the channel on off, on a length, left alone by KL.

Goes fuller, outside off. Sai Sudharsan guides it towards the deep cover region. The substitute fielder has a long chase from backward point, and he does well to save the boundary with his dive. 3 runs taken.
Tailing back in from around the wicket, on a good length, on middle, Sai presses back and whips it to mid-wicket.
On a back of a length, just around that sixth stump line. KL Rahul shoulders arms at it.
Attacking the front pad with a full ball, KL Rahul gets his bat out in front and taps it to mid on.
Pitches it on the good length, just around the middle and off. KL Rahul defends it back to the bowler.
Lands it on a nagging length, on middle and leg, Sai flicks it through square leg for a single.
Lands it on the good length, just nipping back into the batter. Sai Sudharsan gets on the back foot and blocks it back to the bowler.
Going across the batter, on a shortish length, Sai Sudharsan plays a bit away from his body as he gets on his toes and steers it down towards gully.
This moves away off the deck, a bit full, outside off, Rahul shoulders arms.
The length is pulled back but keeps it in that testing line, just outside the off stump, Rahul watchfully makes a leave.
Goes wider on the crease and fires in a full ball, on off, Rahul plays it off the front foot to mid off.
On the shorter side, wide on off, an easy leave for Rahul.
On the pads, on a short of a length, Sai works it down to deep backward square leg and gets to the other end.

An absolute beauty! Slanting in, another wobble seam ball, on a good length, Sai Sudharsan looks to block it out off the front foot with a straight bat. The ball straightens off the deck to whistle past the outside edge.
Shaping away, around off, on a length, KL Rahul tucks his bat inside the line and keeps it behind the front pad to make the leave.
Lands it a bit full, in the channel on off, KL Rahul leaves the ball alone.
Slanting in at the hips, KL Rahul stands tall and tucks it to mid-wicket from the crease.
Fuller in length, aimed at the stumps, KL Rahul gets forward and turns it to mid-wicket.
On off, on a short of a length, seaming away, KL Rahul is a bit opened up in defence. The outside edge is found but it goes down onto the ground before dribbling towards gully.
On a good length, on off, KL Rahul pats it back to the bowler off the back foot.
A lot straighter this time, on off and middle, on a good length, Sai plays it back to Carse.
On top of off, on a back of a length, Sai Sudharsan covers the line and stabs it down on the off side.
Angling in and then nibbling away off the deck, Sai Sudharsan does well not to follow the trajectory of the ball and tucks his bat inside the line to let the ball pass.
On a short of a good length, on off, Sai Sudharsan gets right behind it to keep it out.

FOUR! Streaky but Sai Sudharsan is up and running in Test cricket! On a hard length, on off, Sai Sudharsan waits back to block it down with an angled bat down on the off side. Gets more of an outside edge but since Sai had attempted to defend it with soft hands, the outside edge went into the ground and raced away between third slip and gully.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Brydon Carse with the early breakthrough for England! From around the wicket, wobble-seam delivery, on a hard length, around off, Yashasvi Jaiswal hangs back and is forced into playing it due to the angle coming into him. Stays back and gets his hands high near his chest to defend. The ball slants in before straightening enough to catch the outside edge and the keeper, Jamie Smith, gobbles it up to his left. Jaiswal falls for 4 (11). India are now 16/1, leading by 22 runs.
Yashasvi Jaiswal c J Smith b B Carse 4 (11b 1x4 0x6)
This is on a short of a length, on off, punched off the back foot to cover by KL.

FOUR! Majestic! Bowled from wide of the crease on the over-the-wicket angle, on off, on a length, this does not do much in the air or off the deck, Rahul presses on the front foot and eases himself into the drive through covers for a boundary.
On the fuller side, swinging away from the right-hander, KL Rahul leaves the ball alone.
Hurls it on a nagging length, just outside off, dabbed down towards backward point by KL.
FOUR! In complete control this time! Fractionally short but wide enough, Rahul arches back and cuts it away all along the ground to the right of backward point for a boundary.

Almost dragged it back onto the stumps! Moving away a bit off the seam, on a back of a length, outside off, Rahul gets on his toes to force it through the off side. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps and rolls down to deep fine leg for a couple.
On a hard length, outside off, Yashasvi stands tall to punch it away through the off side. Miscues it off the inner half beside the pitch on the leg side.

FOUR! Yashasvi Jaiswal is underway! Brydon Carse bends his back and digs it in short, around the left shoulder of the batter. Jaiswal is a bit hurried and the ball gets a bit big on him. Takes his eyes as he plays the swivel-hook. Hits it to the right of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
From around the wicket for the left-hander, on a short of a good length, outside off, Yashasvi Jaiswal lifts his bat high and lets it go.
A bit too straight, on the pads, on a good length, Rahul nudges it to the right of mid on and gets off the mark with a single.
Angling in, on middle and leg, on a hard length, Rahul hops and tucks it beside the pitch on the leg side.
Lands it on a hard length, seaming away, outside off, KL Rahul shoulders arms.
